, &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">By\nassuming the position of Shambhavi Mudra a Yogi should see the self.&nbsp; When the Brahma is seen in the form of a dot\nhe should fix his mind on it and nowhere else.&nbsp;&nbsp;\nA Yogi who knows the science of Shambhavi he himself becomes Brahma&nbsp; and none else.&nbsp;&nbsp; I, Lord Maheshwara (Shiva), am telling this\nagain and again that this is truth.-&nbsp;&nbsp; <b>Gherand Samhita ( Hatha Yoga ) 5000 BC<o:p></o:p></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Gheranda\nSamhita is a 7 tier yoga:<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; color: purple; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: large; line-height: 200%;\">Shatkarma\nfor purification<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; color: purple; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: large; line-height: 200%;\">Asana\nfor strengthening<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; color: purple; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: large; line-height: 200%;\">Mudra\nfor steadying<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; color: purple; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: large; line-height: 200%;\">Pratyahara\nfor calming<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; color: purple; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: large; line-height: 200%;\">Pranayama\nfor lightness<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; color: purple; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: large; line-height: 200%;\">Dhyana\nfor perception<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; line-height: 200%;\"><span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\"><span style=\"color: purple; font-size: large;\">Sam\u0101dhi\nfor isolation</span></span><span style=\"font-size: 14pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">The\nwhite invader has kicked forward Gherand Samhita by an amazing 6600 years\n--thank god that they did NOT claim to have written it like our Vedas .<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<iframe allowfullscreen=\"\" class=\"YOUTUBE-iframe-video\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/K2G0mI8dw08/0.jpg\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/K2G0mI8dw08?feature=player_embedded\" width=\"320\"></iframe></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Gherand Samhita which\nmeans Gherand\u2019s collection was recorded as a conversation between Chanda Kapila\nand Gherand in which Chanda Kapila asked Gherand to impart him knowledge about\nthe physical discipline of Yoga that would lead to knowledge of the tattvaas\n(truth). <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Gherand responds by\nsaying that there are no fetters like those of illusion, no strength like that\nwhich comes from the discipline of yoga, no friend better than knowledge and no\nenemy greater than ego. &nbsp;Just as by\nlearning the alphabet, one can read, similarly by practicing yoga one can\nobtain knowledge of the truth.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Different pranayams, 3\nforms of meditation and 32 asanas (poses) are mentioned in the Gherand Samhita.\n&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Gherand says that the\nbody should be purified and strengthened and the exercises that lead to this\npurification and strengthening can be put in the following seven categories:<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">1. Purificatory-\nthrough the shat karmas or six steps<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">2.\nStrengthening-through regular practice of asanas/poses<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">3.\nSteadying-accomplished through mudras<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">4. Calming-through\npratyahar<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">5. Lightness of\nbody-through pranayam<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">6. Perception-through\nmeditation<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">7. Solitude or\nisolation-accomplished through Samadhi<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">1.\nPurificatory-accomplished by following the shat karmas which are:<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">a. Dhauti which is of 4\ntypes<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">i. Antardhauti\n(internal cleansing)<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">1. vatasara(wind\npurification)<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">2. varisura (water\npurification)<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">3. Vahnisara (fire\npurification)<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">4. Bahiskrita<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">ii. Dantadhauti (teeth\ncleaning) which is purification of<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">1. teeth<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">2. root of the tongue<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">3. both ears<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">4. frontal sinuses<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">iii. Hridayadhauti\n(heart cleaning) by using<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">1. stick<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">2. vomiting<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">3. cloth<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">iv. Mulashodhana\n(rectal cleaning)<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">b. Basti which is of 2\ntypes:<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">i. Jala basti (wet)\ndone in water<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">ii. Sukshuma basti\n(dry) done on land<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">c. Neti<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">d. Laukiki<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">e. Trataka-cures all\neye disease and clairvoyance is induced<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">f. Kapalbhati which is\nof 3 types which destroys all disorders related to phlegm (kapha)<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">i. Vat krama (alternate\nnostril breathing without force and without kumbhaka).<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">ii. Vyut karma (drawing\nin water through the nostrils and expelling it through the mouth<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">iii. Sheet karma\n(drinking water through the mouth and expelling through the nostrils)<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">2.\nStrengthening-through regular practice of asanas/poses. Shiva described 840,000\nasanas as many as there are species of living beings. Out of this 84 are the\nbest and of these 32 have been found most useful for mankind. Those 32 asanas\nare:<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">1) Siddhasana or\nPerfect Pose<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">2) Padmasana or Lotus\nPose<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">3) Bhadrasan or Happy\nPose<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">4) Muktam or Free Pose<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">5) Vajram or Adamant\nPose<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">6) Swastika or\nProsperous Pose<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">7) Singham or Lion Pose<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">8 ) Gomukh or Cow mouth\nPose<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">9) Vira or Hero Pose<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">10) Dhanur or Bow Pose<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">11) Mritasan, or\nShavasan or Corpse Pose<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">12) Guptam or Hidden\nPose<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">13) Matsyam or Fish\nPose<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">14) Matsendra or King\nof Fish Psoe<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">15) Goraksha<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">16) Paschimottan or\nForward Bend Pose<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">17) Uttkatam<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">18) Sankatam or\nDangerous Pose<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">19) Mayuram or Peacock\nPose<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">20) Kukkutam<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">21) Kurma or Tortoise\nPose<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">22) Uttana Manduka<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">23) Uttan Kurmakam<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">24) Vriksha or Tree\nPose<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">25) Manduka or Frog\nPose<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">26) Garuda or Eagle\nPose<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">27) Vrisham or Bull\nPose<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">28) Shalabh or Locust\nPose<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">29) Makara or Crocodile\nPose<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">30) Ushtram or Camel\nPose<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">31) Bhujangam or Snake\nPose<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">32) Yoga<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">3.\nSteadying-accomplished through mudras<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Through the practice of\nthese mudras, the yogi can accomplish victory over death, decay, old age,\ndiseases. &nbsp;&nbsp;The mudras described in the\nGherand Samhita are:<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">1) Mahamudra 2) Nabho\nmudra 3) Uddiyana Bandha 4) Jalandhar Bandha 5) Mula Bandha 6) Maha Bandha 7)\nMahabheda 8 ) Khechari Mudra 9)Viparitkarni 10) Yoni Mudra 11) Vajroni Mudra\n12) Shakti chalani 13) Tadagi (tank) Mudra 14) Manduki Mudra 15) Shambhavi\nMudra 16) Panchadharan or five dharanas (see below) 22)Ashwini 23) Pasini 24)\nKaki 25) Bhujangini<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The five dharana mudras\nare mudras through which a yogi can accomplish anything. He can travel between\nrealms and through space, and can travel at the speed of mind.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">1) Parthivi-earthy<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">2) Ambhasi-watery<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">3) Vayavi-aerial<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">4) Agney-fire<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">5) Akashi-sky/ethereal<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">4. Calming-through\npratyahar or dharana or restraining of the mind<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">a. One should bring\ntheir restless mind/thoughts under control whenever it wanders off and gets\ndistracted by material sense objects. Mind follows sight. SO bring the mind\nunder your control. Whether it is praise or criticism by others, good speech or\nbad speech, good smells or odors, tastes etc, one should constantly practice\nwithdrawal of the mind from distracting thoughts and bring it under his\ncontrol.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">5. Lightness of body\u2013\naccomplished through pranayam through the practice of which, one becomes god\nlike<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">a. The requirements for\nsuccess at pranayam are an appropriate space, appropriate time, moderate food,\nand purification of nadis.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">b. In order to achieve\nsuccess in pranayam, one should not practice in a foreign land (as in a far off\nland he may lose faith), in a forest as there is danger for one\u2019s safety, in a\ncity as curious people will cause distraction<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">c. Pranayam should be\npracticed in a hut, free from insects, in a secluded place<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">d. Pranayam should not\nbe commenced in summer (May, June), rainy (Jul, Aug), winter (Nov, Dec), frigid\ncold (Jan, Feb) as one will contract disease. A beginner should begin his\npractice in Spring (Mar, Apr) or fall (Sept, Oct) as one attains success with\nthis and also does not contract any illness<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">e. A yogi should eat\nmoderately (mit-ahar) to attain success and avoid illness.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">f. Foods allowed are\nrice, mung beans, urhad, chick peas, barley, wheat, cucumber, eggplant, yam,\nsago, radish, jackfruit, plantains, figs, foods that are pure, cooling and\nsweet.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">g. the five greens\nleaves i.e. holy basil (tulsi), amaranth leaf, parvar leaf, lamb\u2019s quarters and\nbrahmi should be revered by the yogi. Food should be consumed to occupy 50% of\nthe stomach. Another for \u00bc of water and the other \u00bc should be kept empty.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">h. Bitter, acidic,\nsalty and roasted foods should be avoided. Excess of leafy green vegetables,\nmasur beans, pumpkins, onions, hing (asafetida) etc. should be avoided. Very\nhot, stale and hard to digest food should be avoided a swell as food that is\ntoo cooling or exciting.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">i. Fresh butter, ghee\nmilk, sugar, date, cardamoms, nutmeg, dates, rose apple, pomegranate, sweet\njuice and nourishing, easily digestible and cooling foods should be consumed by\na yogi.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">j. Early morning baths\n(before sunrise), fasting should be avoided as they harm the body. A yogi can\nremain without food for 3 hours. In the beginning a meal of milk and ghee twice\na day at noon and in the evening is recommended.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">k. He should sit on a\nseat made of kusa grass or tiger skin or antelope skin and face east or north\nwith a calm disposition and practice nadi shuddhi (purification of nadis or\nenergy channels in the astral body) prior to commencing pranayam.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">l. The air element\ncannot flow through nadis that are cloggd with impurities. One needs to purify\nthese energy channels prior to performing pranayam<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">m. Purification of\nnadis is of 2 types-samanu and nirmanu. Samanu is done with a beej mantra and\nnirmanu is done in conjunction with dhauti cleansing practices (the dhauti has\nalready been mentioned above).<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">n. The yogi should sit\nin Padmasan and after completing the rituals towards his guru begin purifying\nhis nadis.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">o. Nadi shuddhi is done\nby inhaling and mentally chanting the beej mantra for air which is \u2018yung\u2019for 16\ncounts, retaining the breath for 64 counts of the mantra and exhaling for 32\ncounts. Do the same starting with inhalation from right nostril and mentally\nchanting the beej mantra for the fire element which is \u2018rung\u2019 in the same ratio\nas above. Then focus the gaze on the tip of nose and visualizing the reflection\nof the moon inhale while mentally chanting \u2018thum\u2019 16 times, retain 64 times\nchanting \u2018vam\u2019 and exhale 32 times chanting \u2018lam\u2019 while also visualizing the\nthe nectar from the moon is flowing into the nadis. This helps purify the nadis\nand prepares one to begin practice of pranayam.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">p. Kumbhakas or breath\nretention is of 8 types: sahita, surya bheda, ujjayi, sheetali, bhastrika,\nbhramari, murcha and kevali. Sahita kumbhaka is of 2 type-sagarbha (performed\nwith repetition of beej mantra) and nirgarbha (without mantra repetition).<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">q. In sahita kumbhaka,\nthe best ratio is puraka or inhalation 20 secs, kubhaka or retention for 80\nseconds and rechaka or exhalation for 40 seconds. The moderate ratio is\n16:64:32 and the beginner ratio is 12:48:32<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">r. Success in the\npractice of the beginner pranayam results in profuse sweating of the body, the\nmoderate one results in quivering (in the area of the spinal cord), and the\nbest one results in levitation.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">s. Practice of pranayam\nresults in calmness of mind, cure of diseases, awakening of mental faculties,\nawakening of kundalini, levitation, and attainment of bliss.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">t. Suryabheda pranayam\nconsists of inhalation through the right nostril, as per one\u2019s capacity,\nfollowed by retention until perspiration comes forth from the tips of the nails\nand roots of the hair while doing jalandhar bandha, and smooth exhalation\nthrough left nostril. This kumbhaka destroys decay, death and increases the\nbodily fire. It helps awaken kundalini.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">u. For ujjayi pranayam\none should draw in air through both nostrils and hold it in the mouth and also\ndraw in air from the chest and throat and hold it in the mouth followed by\nJalandhar bandha and breath retention for as long as possible. Ujjayi helps one\nget rid of all sickness and disease, decreptitude and death. A different\nversion is given in the Hatha Yoga Pradipika according to which the yogi should\nkeep the mouth closed and inhale through both nostrils while constricting the\nthroat muscles so that a hissing sound is produced, hold the breath (perform\nkumbhaka) and exhale through ida (left nostril). This Ujjayi can be done\nwalking or standing. It destroys all diseases of the throat, increases\ndigestive fire and destroys diseases of the nadis.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">v. For shitali\npranayam, stick the tongue out and inhale through the lips and tongue and into\nthe stomach, retain for a while and then exhale through both nostrils. This is\ngreat for indigestion, phlegm and bile related disorders and promotes bliss.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">w. Bhastrika kumbhaka\ninvolves quick inspiration and expiration though the nostrils twenty times and\nat the end perform kumbhaka. This destroys all disease and keeps illness away.\nThe yogi should practice this 3 times a day.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">x. Bhramari pranayam\nshould be practiced past midnight so no animal sounds are audible. The yogi\nshould inhale and retain breath while closing the ears with his hands. He will\nhear various sounds in his right ear. The first sound being that of crickets\nfollowed by lute, thunder, drum, beetle, bells, gongs, trumpets, mridanga\n(drums) etc. Last sound heard is that of anahat, which arises from the heart.\nWith successin bhramari one gets Samadhi (union with cosmic consciousness).<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">y. Murcha is done by\nretaining breath and focusing the attention in the space between the two\neyebrows. This brings happiness and bliss.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">z. Kevala Kumbhaka is\nthe retention of breath without inhalation and exhalation. Upon inhalation\nthrough both nostrils, the yogi should hold his breath. This kumbhaka should be\nperformed eight times a day, once every 3 hours, or one may do it thrice a\nday-morning, noon and evening. There is nothing that a yogi cannot accomplish\nwith success in kevala kumbhaka. The breath of each person makes the sound \u2018So\u2019\nduring inhalation and \u2018hum\u2019 during exhalation. Sohum or soham is the also\ncalled the Ajap (without chanting) Gayatri as every human being constantly\nperforms 21,600 times a day (15 breaths per minute) without being aware of it.\nThe mantra is also called hamsa or hansa. This repetition takes place in three\nplaces-in the root chakra, the lotus located in the heart chakra and in ajna\nchakra ( the third eye- the space where the two nostrils meet). The vibration\nof sohum matches the natural vibration of our breath. It means, \u201cI am That\u201d.\nInternal/mental chanting of this mantra (Sooooo with inhalation and hummmmm with\nexhalation helps one attain stillness and realize their true self).<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">HYPERVENTILATION IS NOT ALLOWED IN YOGA--UNLESS IT IS DONE BRIEFLY TO SHIFT THE PREDOMINANT NOSTRIL</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2016/09/hyperventilation-followed-by-valsalva.html\" style=\"background-color: lime;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2016/09/hyperventilation-followed-by-valsalva.html</a><o:p></o:p></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<br /></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">6. Perception-through\nmeditation<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">a. Meditation is of 3\ntypes- sthula (gross), jyotirmay (luminous), and suksham (subtle). These\nmeditations will help one directly perceive their true self.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">b. Meditation on an\nimage of guru is gross meditation, meditation on the lord as a bright light is\ncalled luminous or jyotis meditation and contemplation on Him as a point and\nkundali force is called suksma or subtle meditation.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">c. Gross Meditation:<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">i. Close your eyes and\nvisualize an ocean of nectar in the heart. In this ocean is an island made of\ngemstones and the sand of which is made of crushed diamonds and rubies. The\nisland is flanked by kadamba trees that have sweet smelling flowers. There are other\nflowering trees like malati, mallika jati, champa, parijat, padma, and the\nfragrance of these flowers is everywhere. In the middle of this garden is the\nkalpa vriksha (wish fulfilling tree) with 4 main branches that represent the 4\nvedas (revered Hindu texts) and numerous flowers and fruits. The sound of bees\nand cuckoo can be heard. Beneath the tree visualize a platform made of gems and\non that platform visualize a throne made of precious gemstones. Seated on this\nthrone visualize your deity. Contemplate on the form, garments, ornaments etc\nof this deity. This is sthula meditation or gross meditation.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">d. Luminous Meditation:<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u2022 In the muladhar\nchakra (root chakra), the kundalini lies in 3and 1/2 coils. Here is a flame\nthat represents the living being (jivatama). Meditate on this luminous flame.\nThrough this meditation a yogi can directly perceive the soul.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u2022 In shambhavi mudra,\nwhen the gaze is fixed at luminous \u2018OM\u2019, the third eye, between the two\neyebrows without blinking subtle meditation is accomplished. Subtle meditation\nis superior to luminous meditation and luminous meditation is superior to gross\nmeditation.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">e. Subtle Meditation:<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u2022 This can be achieved\nby performing Shambhavi mudra without blinking. When through tremendous good\nfortune, a yogi\u2019s kundalini awakens; she unites with the soul and leaves the\nbody through the eyes. This Suksham or subtle dhyana is difficult to obtain.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">7. Solitude or\nisolation-accomplished through Samadhi Yoga<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">a. Samadhi Yoga is\nattainable only by the very fortunate; through the divine grace of the guru, by\none who is devoted to his guru, who has confidence in the knowledge and faith\nis his guru and himself, and whose mind is open to intelligence day by day.\nSamadhi or mukti (freedom) is attained upon separation of the mind from the\nbody and its union with the supreme soul. \u201cI\u201d am intelligence, existence and\nbliss.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">b. Samadhi is of 6\ntypes:<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">i. Dhyan Samadhi\n(meditation samadhi)-accomplished by shambhavi mudra<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">ii. Nada Samadhi (sound\nsamadhi)-accomplished by bhramari mudra<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">iii. Rasananda Samadhi\n(bliss in taste)- accomplished by khechari mudra<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">iv. Laya Samadhi\n(absorption)-accomplished by yoni mudra<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">v. Bhakti Yoga\nSamadhi-accomplished through contemplation on one\u2019s deity<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">vi. Raja Yoga Samadhi,\nUnmani Samadhi, Sahajawastha Samadhi-attained through mano murchha mudra\n(trance)<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\">Vedas\nwent of oral route for 330 centuries before being penned down&nbsp; 70 centuries ago.&nbsp;</span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\">It is the greatest feat of\nman.&nbsp;</span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\">The verses on oral route was penned down only because the Maharishis in\nall their widom knew that the human DNA is getting degrades\u2014and if not written\ndown , it will be corrupted and even lost forever </span></span><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">As per\nthe 7000 year old Vedas,&nbsp; perception\noccurs in the gap of alert attention. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">This\nis the inner space.&nbsp; There are many\nmethods to create this gap.&nbsp; Shambhavi\nMudra is the most potent and easiest method.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Negative\nthoughts&nbsp; create negative feelings and\nhence stress and illness.&nbsp; Our inner\nvoice evaluates, judges, compares and worries.&nbsp;&nbsp;\nMost people live with such a tormentor in their head draining them of\nenergy. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">It is\nan awful burden not to be able to stop thinking.&nbsp; Up to 90 % of most people\u2019s thoughts are\nmeaningless playbacks of old broken \u201crecords\u201d.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Silencing\nthe body is easy, but silencing the mind is difficult in this modern age.&nbsp; Silencing is about grace, harmony and\ntranquility. Exhaustion or being drugged out of your mind is NOT tranquility. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">In the\nmodern age people get stressed, and they need to still the mind--the chattering\nmonkey, which remains entangled in the past and the imagined future, but never\nin the present.&nbsp; A person stops thinking\neither when he is dead or when he has realised.&nbsp;\n<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">When\nyour ego powered mind is chattering like a monkey or the angry sea, you miss\nthe truth.&nbsp; Truth can be communicated\nonly in silence. For this deep silence you need to have harmony between the\nmind, body and spirit.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Shambhavi\nMudra synchronizes the 2 brain lobes to create inner balance.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">When\ntwo energy fields exactly cancel out each other the 5th dimension is accessed\nwhich is all pervasive and has the power to heal.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">He is\nnow in touch with higher levels or higher dimensions of functioning.&nbsp; He will have&nbsp;\nemotional stability and level headed approach to problems which confront\nhim.&nbsp; This is a fast,&nbsp; amazingly simple, drug-free method of\nstimulating neural pathways in the brain.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; line-height: 200%;\"><span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-size: x-large;\"><b>All\nright, now let me talk about practicals.</b></span><span style=\"font-size: 14pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Wear\nloose fitting clothes which does NOT constrict you in any way.&nbsp; Sit on a smooth surface , in a comfortable\nmeditation pose .&nbsp; This is to eliminate\nsense of touch / feeling.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Put\nyour thumbs in your ears and palm your eyes with your middle and fourth finger.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Now do\nOM CHANT with an audible MMMMMMM. ( this generates Nitric Oxide )&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-size: large;\">Below : <span style=\"color: blue;\"><b>Thumbs must be inside ear</b></span> --and three fingers gently palming eyes before you say O<b><span style=\"color: red;\">MMMMMMMMM</span></b>. &nbsp; This generates magic molecule Nitric oxide , if the inner ear cochlea spirit level is balanced&nbsp;</span><br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-D9Flab2G0BA/WPXI_F0itQI/AAAAAAABSs8/YYcXFpREj2EkAYwbzvzUL3zXbsaz8rx4QCLcB/s1600/palmiwng-300x000.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">You\nwill feel intense tingling vibrations inside your ear \u2014 the cochlea spiral\npassage resonates &nbsp;to 7.83 hertz ( OM\nfrequency and also earth\u2019s heart beat frequency) and your brain produces NITRIC\nOXIDE .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Now\nselect a silent, NOT so bright, cool place space, where there are NO strong\nsmells&nbsp; .&nbsp;\nThis is to prevent any input of sense of hearing/sense/ smell .&nbsp;&nbsp; If you can even feel the clock\nticking-put&nbsp; ear plugs \u2013only if you are a\nbeginner.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Keep\nthe head,&nbsp; shoulder and spine upright and\nstraight.&nbsp; And place the hands on the\nknees in (Jyana Mudra). &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Upright is to keep the spirit level in the\ninner ear at equilibrium so that your brain lobes get balanced and\nsynchronized.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Shut\nyour eyes.&nbsp;&nbsp; No need to be cockeyed .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Simply\nbe mindful of in-and-out diaphragmatic breathing where you stomach rises and\nfalls.&nbsp;&nbsp; You may feel that your breathing\nis too short, too long, too gentle or too heavy.&nbsp; Do not try to control it.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">When\nyou become distracted, gently refocus your attention on your breathing.&nbsp;&nbsp; Restrict your attention to what is occurring\nin the immediate present moment.&nbsp;&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">When\nyou feel you have blocked out all ahara ( feed ) via your senses of smell,\nsight, hearing and feeling , take a deep breath where you fill your lungs only\n90 % and hold it .&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Put\nyour tongue on your upper palate and tickle it for just 2 seconds and stop.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Now\nstart exhaling VERY slowly while keeping the tip of your tongue stationary on\nthe roof of your mouth.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Don't\nthink about the past or future\u2014 don't think about anything at all.&nbsp; Let go of worries, concerns , and\nmemories.&nbsp; Empty your mind of\neverything.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">To be\nfrank you cannot think even if if want to \u2014I can challenge you on this .&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Do\nthis 3 more times .&nbsp; This means you\ninhale again , hold your breath and do the same thing.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Later\non you do NOT need to hold your breath and you can do this procedure for LONGER\nTIME , without ear plugs and your eyes open against a blank far away wall of\nyour room.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Do\nthis exercise 5 times a day.&nbsp; You must\nNOT have a full stomach.&nbsp;&nbsp; You can drink\nsome water before you do this.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">This\nis it !<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">\u2014so\nsimple so fast , right?<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">The\ndifference between prayer and meditation is that the former is a petition to\nGod, and the other is a detached observation of one's own mind, and its\nprocesses, after squelching the 5 senses .&nbsp;\n<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">The\naim of every form of meditation is to still the mind, or you cant purify it and\nget rid of deep rooted negativities , which affect your health.&nbsp;&nbsp; If you do meditation the right way , you\nmind will NOT control you \u2013rather you will control your mind.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">For a\nlayman-- you are stressed when your hands feel cold, your heart rate,\nbreathing, and muscle tension increases.&nbsp;\nThe result is that your immune system goes for a toss and you get\ndepressed or burnt out..&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Depression\nis a weird feeling of loss.</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt;\">&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Before\nSHAMBHAVI MUDRA is it good to hear the noise of the shankh.&nbsp; This is a harmonic of Hindu King mantra OM of\nfrequency 7.83 hertz, which is also the earths heart beat called Schumann\u2019s\nresonance . <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Contrary\nto what the immoral idiots of other religions ( who ridicule Hindusim as with\n33 million gods )&nbsp; think\u2014 our God is an\nintelligent field which sustains the golden mean of 1.618 . <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">This\nratio is the basis of our 11000 year old divine geometry Sri Yantra which holds\nthe \u201ctheory of everything\u201d .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">The\npathway of the longitudinal sound waves through the passages of the shell conch\nfollows the golden mean spiral, and it has a positive effect on the cochlea\nspiral, which is basically a scalar wave generator when impinged by\nlongitudinal sound waves of desired frequency.&nbsp;&nbsp;\n<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">This\nhas been noticed by using Kirlean cameras. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Scalar\nfields permeate the body tissues and enhance ion transport at cellular\nlevel..&nbsp;&nbsp; In every Hindu temple a shank\nconch exists. It stimulates the Amygdala with positive vibrations .&nbsp; You enter a mysterious state of psychological\nflow.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Healing\nis NOT a physical process, rather it is mental. Modern medicine is all about\ndestroying the symptoms .&nbsp; ( never mind a\npancreas is doing its job faithfully\u2014hey, remove it ).&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Mind\ncan wipe mistakes off the DNA blueprint and destroy any disease that has\ndisturbed the design.&nbsp; DNA's ability to\nrepair itself is affected adversely when a person is in depression.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Meditation\nexperiences silence, and is devoid of drives, wishes, fears , thoughts and\nemotions. Afterwards when the mind returns to its usual level of consciousness,\nit has acquired some freedom to move..&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Grace\nand peace are the hallmarks of a healthy non-delusional mind in a healthy\nbody.. The happiness is stable.&nbsp;&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Do\nShambhavi Mudra in a grateful frame of mind , to thank the universal laws,\nwhich sustain this planet.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">For\npeople who do NOT know what the amygdala is\u2014<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">All\nsensory data must first pass through the amygdala for emotional analyzing,\nbefore being sent off to the cerebral cortex for processing.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">The\namygdala has in turn been implicated in nearly every psychiatric disorder.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Children\nwith anxiety disorders tend to have a smaller left amygdala. Amygdala uses more\nblood than any other part of the brain.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot;
