margin: 0px 0px 8px;\">\n<cite class=\"user blog-author\" style=\"font-style: normal; font-weight: bold;\"><a href=\"https://www.blogger.com/profile/14410812789424637654\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration-line: none;\">Capt. Ajit Vadakayil</a></cite><span class=\"icon user blog-author\" style=\"background-image: url(&quot;data:image/png; background-repeat: no-repeat; display: inline-block; font-weight: bold; height: 18px; margin: 0px 0px -4px 6px; width: 18px;\"></span><span class=\"datetime secondary-text\" style=\"margin-left: 6px;\"><a href=\"https://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2017/04/sanatana-dharma-hinduism-exhumed-and_17.html?showComment=1492524168683#c6234088874756035142\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration-line: none;\">April 18, 2017 at 7:32 PM</a></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-content\" id=\"bc_0_85MC\" style=\"margin-bottom: 8px; text-align: justify;\">\n<div style=\"font-size: 16px;\">\nhi y,</div>\n<div style=\"font-size: 16px;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div style=\"font-size: 16px;\">\nIRAVAN IS JUST A SIDE CHARACTER IN MAHABHARATA.</div>\n<div style=\"font-size: 16px;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div style=\"font-size: 16px;\">\nOn the 8th day of Kurukshetra war Arjuna\u2019s son Iravan was killed.</div>\n<div style=\"font-size: 16px;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div style=\"font-size: 16px;\">\nThis son of Arjuna by his Naga wife had come and joined the Pandava forces at Kurukshetra. Duryodhana sent his friend, the Rakshasa Alambasa, to oppose the Naga warrior.</div>\n<div style=\"font-size: 16px;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div style=\"font-size: 16px;\">\nIravan was slain after a fierce fight. When Arjuna heard this, he broke down completely</div>\n<div style=\"font-size: 16px;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div style=\"font-size: 16px;\">\nSeeing Iravan killed, Ghatotkacha ( son of the Pandava Bhima and the Rakshasi Hidimbi ) uttered a loud war-cry which made all the assembled soldiers tremble. And with his division, he fell upon the Kaurava army ferociously. So great was the destruction he wrought that at many points the Kaurava formation was broken</div>\n<div style=\"font-size: 16px;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div style=\"font-size: 16px;\">\n<b><span style=\"color: red;\">THIS SIDE STORY HAS BEEN USED BY JEW ROTHSCHILDs FAKE MUTTS TO CREATE BULLSHIT STORIES TO MAKE THE HINDU SELF LOATHING</span></b></div>\n<div style=\"font-size: 16px;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div style=\"font-size: 16px;\">\n<b><span style=\"color: blue;\">MUCH WORSE THAN WHAT WIKIPEDIA HAS SAID IS DONE TODAY, USING CROSS DRESSED TAMIL DALITS TO RIDICULE HINDUISM..</span></b></div>\n<div style=\"font-size: 16px;\">\n<b><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></b></div>\n<div style=\"font-size: 16px;\">\n<b><span style=\"color: blue;\">THE BENAMI MEDIA, JNU COMMIES AND LITERARY FEST DROHIS LOVE THIS DENEGRATION</span></b></div>\n<div style=\"font-size: 16px;\">\n<br /></div>\n<span style=\"color: purple; font-size: large;\">JNU commie professors come out with new new stories every years--stating we have done research in Malaysia / Indonesia etc ---all lies</span><br />\n<div style=\"font-size: 16px;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div style=\"font-size: 16px;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div style=\"font-size: 16px;\">\n##########################</div>\n<div style=\"font-size: 16px;\">\nAravan (\u0b85\u0bb0\u0bb5\u0bbe\u0ba9\u0bcd, Arav\u0101\u1e47). He is also a patron god of well-known transgender communities called ThiruNangai (also Aravani in South India, and Hijra throughout South Asia). . Aravan requested that he be married before his death. Krishna satisfied this boon in his female form, Mohini. In Koovagam (\u0b95\u0bc2\u0bb5\u0bbe\u0b95\u0bae\u0bcd), Tamil Nadu, this incident is re-enacted in an 18-day festival, first by a ceremonial marriage of Aravan to ThiruNangais and male villagers (who have taken vows to Aravan) and then by their widowhood after ritual re-enactment of Aravan's sacrifice. &nbsp;Aravan is worshipped in the form of his severed head and is believed to cure disease and induce pregnancy in childless women. . Separate Javanese traditions present a dramatic marriage of Irawan to Titisari, daughter of Krishna.. The French Indologist Madeleine Biardeau describes religious use of the word I\u1e0d\u0101 as reference to an \"oblatory substance consumed by the participants from which comes all <span style=\"color: blue;\">fecundity of the sacrifice</span>\".[6..Aravan is always worshipped in temples in the form of his severed head. Typically, he also wears a conical crown, a Vaishnava tilak mark on his forehead and earrings..Some paintings also depict the sacrifice of Aravan. In these scenes, he is often depicted bowing to Kali, while his head is about to be severed; or, as in one Sowcarpet painting, a self-decapitated Aravan holds both a sword and his own severed head, offering the latter to the goddess.[16][17] the Tamil versions discuss Aravan's (Tamil name) ritual self-sacrifice to Kali before the war. Hiltebeitel relates this to the <span style=\"color: blue;\">South Indian glorification of \"heroic\" self-mutilation and self-decapitation before a goddess</span>.[24][25] He takes particular note of a scene towards the end of a puranic text, Devi Mahatmyam, in interpreting old Tamil sculptures depicting a warrior king spilling his own blood.. In Villiputuralvar's 14th-century version, <span style=\"color: blue;\">Krishna first offers himself as the sacrificial victim</span>, but Aravan volunteers to replace him. <span style=\"color: blue;\">Krishna tricks the gods Surya (the Sun) and Chandra (the Moon) to co-ordinate their movements so that the day of the new moon will fall one day earlier</span>\u2014the current day. &nbsp; &nbsp;Another version, popular with transsexuals, cites the reason behind Aravan's wish to be \"c<span style=\"color: blue;\">oital bliss\" and tells explicitly about consummation of the marriage.</span>[54][55] ..The Kuttantavar cult ritualizes both the heroic death and the marriage ceremony\u2014enacted by ThiruNangais (officially, <span style=\"color: blue;\">\"eunuchs\" in Tamil Nadu</span>)..Sometimes a <span style=\"color: blue;\">chicken is sacrificed</span> on stage in a terukuttu performance to signify the sacrifice.[56][59] In Villiputuralvar's retelling, an <span style=\"color: blue;\">elephant is sacrificed to the goddess</span>, complementing Aravan's own self-sacrifice.[49]..Krishna asks Aravan\u2014the sole witness of the entire war, \"who was truly responsible for winning this war?\"</div>\n<div style=\"font-size: 16px;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div style=\"font-size: 16px;\">\nCONTINUED TO 2--</div>\n</div>\n<div style=\"font-size: 16px;\">\n<span class=\"comment-actions secondary-text\" id=\"bc_0_85MN\" kind=\"m\"><span class=\"item-control blog-admin pid-1783552029\" style=\"display: inline;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"comment-replies\" id=\"bc_0_85BR\" style=\"font-size: 16px; margin-left: 36px; margin-top: 1em;\">\n</div>\n<div class=\"comment-replybox-single\" id=\"bc_0_85B_box\" style=\"font-size: 16px; margin-left: 48px; margin-top: 5px;\">\n</div>\n</li>\n<li class=\"comment\" id=\"bc_0_86B\" kind=\"b\" style=\"font-size: 16px; margin: 0px 0px 16px; padding: 0.25em 0px 8px;\"><div class=\"avatar-image-container\" style=\"float: left; margin: 0.2em 0px 0px; max-height: 36px; overflow: hidden; width: 36px;\">\n<img src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-57G2xiZ-5tM/WJwrrVpmOmI/AAAAAAABQqo/-9wsspdm4RAiWSVRYXpBpkgoVBQdEyLRQCK4B/s35/*\" style=\"border: 1px solid rgb(238, 238, 238); max-width: 36px;\" /></div>\n<div class=\"comment-block\" id=\"c3357639305942018627\" style=\"margin-left: 48px; position: relative;\">\n<div class=\"comment-header\" id=\"bc_0_86M\" kind=\"m\" style=\"margin: 0px 0px 8px;\">\n<cite class=\"user blog-author\" style=\"font-style: normal; font-weight: bold;\"><a href=\"https://www.blogger.com/profile/14410812789424637654\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration-line: none;\">Capt. Ajit Vadakayil</a></cite><span class=\"icon user blog-author\" style=\"background-image: url(&quot;data:image/png; background-repeat: no-repeat; display: inline-block; font-weight: bold; height: 18px; margin: 0px 0px -4px 6px; width: 18px;\"></span><span class=\"datetime secondary-text\" style=\"margin-left: 6px;\"><a href=\"https://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2017/04/sanatana-dharma-hinduism-exhumed-and_17.html?showComment=1492524245666#c3357639305942018627\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration-line: none;\">April 18, 2017 at 7:34 PM</a></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-content\" id=\"bc_0_86MC\" style=\"margin-bottom: 8px; text-align: justify;\">\nCONTINUED FROM 1-<br />\n<br />\nAravan replies that he saw two things: <span style=\"color: blue;\">Krishna's discus decapitating the enemy, and his conch shell collecting their blood. &nbsp;&nbsp;</span>The severed head of Aravan is a common motif in Draupadi's temples. Often it is a portable wooden head; sometimes this even has its<span style=\"color: blue;\"> own shrine in the temple complex.[</span>68]<span style=\"color: blue;\"> Icons of Aravan's head are also often placed on the corners and edges of Draupadi temple roofs.</span> His main temple is in Koovagam,[71] Tamil Nadu. Here, the marriage of Aravan and Mohini, Krishna's female form, and her widowhood and mourning,Although local Aravanis have been part of this festival for many years, since the 1960s, a large number of Aravanis have come to the festival from further afield: from throughout Tamil Nadu, from the whole of India, and even from as far away as Singapore.[51][74] About <span style=\"color: blue;\">25,000 transvestites, including the Aravanis, visit the festival</span>.[75] ..During the first six days of the Kuttantavar festival, Aravan's head (cami) is \"danced\" around the streets of Kuvagam.. Traditionally, <span style=\"color: blue;\">goats and chickens are sacrificed.</span> On the 13th day, Aravan's \"soul\" is ritually transferred from his head to a pot..Even married men and <span style=\"color: blue;\">men afflicted with diseases, all dressed as women</span>, are described as ritually \"marrying\" Aravan in the festival, to please the deity.[79]..After this dance, the priest marries the Aravanis to Aravan through the traditional thali-tying ceremony. The Aravanis then conduct sex work, symbolic of consummating their ritual marriage. A \"night of <span style=\"color: blue;\">wild revelry and sexual promiscuity</span>\" follows for the Aravanis.[55][72] &nbsp; <b><span style=\"color: red;\">&nbsp;THIS FUCKING STILL TAKES PLACE AND EVR PERIYAR PARTY POLICE DO NOT ARREST.</span></b>. &nbsp; &nbsp;The head is then paraded around the village on a portable platform called a ketayam. The ceremony ends with a<span style=\"color: blue;\"> sacrificial offering of roosters. </span>The \"widowed\" <span style=\"color: blue;\">Aravanis, with their hair dishevelled, lament the death of their \"husband\"</span> as he performs the kalappali. The garlands from Aravan's image are thrown at devotees one by one, symbolizing his gradual loss of vitality. At this \"weeping ground\", the Aravanis mourn Aravan's death by breaking their bangles, <span style=\"color: blue;\">beating their breasts and discarding their bridal finery, like the legendary Mohini-Krishna. </span>They<span style=\"color: blue;\"> cut their thalis, which are flung at a post erected for the ceremony </span>(vellikkal). After bathing, they<span style=\"color: blue;\"> put on white saris as a mark of their widowhood. </span>The Aravanis bear these signs of widowhood for a month before re-adorning themselves with bangles and coloured saris again.[77]Also at the alukalam, a symbolic sacrifice of cooked <span style=\"color: blue;\">\"blood rice\" is distributed </span>in honour of the deceased Aravan. This rice is believed to make childless women conceive. After the death rites at dusk, the chariot is now considered a \"house of death\", and the lifeless head is removed from the frame of its skeletal body, then covered by a cloth, and finally paraded around the village as though at a funeral. The head is taken to the temple of Kali, where is it \"revived\". On the 18th and final day, the head is decorated and paraded around the village a final time. In the evening, the <span style=\"color: blue;\">pujari (\"priest\") as Yudhishthira (Dharmaraja) crowns Aravan's head in a coronation ceremony held in the inner sanctum of his temple.</span>[77][81]..<br />\nThe officiating priest first takes a sword, striking pieces from the head.<br />\n<br />\nCONTINUED TO 3</div>\n<span class=\"comment-actions secondary-text\" id=\"bc_0_86MN\" kind=\"m\"><span class=\"item-control blog-admin pid-1783552029\" style=\"display: inline;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-replies\" id=\"bc_0_86BR\" style=\"margin-left: 36px; margin-top: 1em;\">\n</div>\n<div class=\"comment-replybox-single\" id=\"bc_0_86B_box\" style=\"margin-left: 48px; margin-top: 5px;\">\n</div>\n</li>\n<li class=\"comment\" id=\"bc_0_87B\" kind=\"b\" style=\"border-bottom: 0px; font-size: 16px; margin: 0px 0px 16px; padding: 0.25em 0px 0px;\"><div class=\"avatar-image-container\" style=\"float: left; margin: 0.2em 0px 0px; max-height: 36px; overflow: hidden; width: 36px;\">\n<img src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-57G2xiZ-5tM/WJwrrVpmOmI/AAAAAAABQqo/-9wsspdm4RAiWSVRYXpBpkgoVBQdEyLRQCK4B/s35/*\" style=\"border: 1px solid rgb(238, 238, 238); max-width: 36px;\" /></div>\n<div class=\"comment-block\" id=\"c6460536491838490624\" style=\"margin-left: 48px; position: relative;\">\n<div class=\"comment-header\" id=\"bc_0_87M\" kind=\"m\" style=\"margin: 0px 0px 8px;\">\n<cite class=\"user blog-author\" style=\"font-style: normal; font-weight: bold;\"><a href=\"https://www.blogger.com/profile/14410812789424637654\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration-line: none;\">Capt. Ajit Vadakayil</a></cite><span class=\"icon user blog-author\" style=\"background-image: url(&quot;data:image/png; background-repeat: no-repeat; display: inline-block; font-weight: bold; height: 18px; margin: 0px 0px -4px 6px; width: 18px;\"></span><span class=\"datetime secondary-text\" style=\"margin-left: 6px;\"><a href=\"https://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2017/04/sanatana-dharma-hinduism-exhumed-and_17.html?showComment=1492524326974#c6460536491838490624\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration-line: none;\">April 18, 2017 at 7:35 PM</a></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-content\" id=\"bc_0_87MC\" style=\"margin-bottom: 8px; text-align: justify;\">\nCONTINUED FROM 2<br />\n<br />\nThe officiating priest first takes a sword, striking pieces from the head. Then, a pumpkin is sliced into 32 pieces, symbolizing 32 pieces of Aravan's sacrificed body. Next, Aravan is fed his own \"blood\", represented by the <span style=\"color: blue;\">blood of goat, sacrificed </span>to Aravan beforehand. Aravan's body from the neck downwards is then covered with a bloodstained white cloth. Finally, <span style=\"color: blue;\">blood-soaked rice</span> is sprinkled on Aravan's face. Devotees, as in the Kuttantavar cult, believe <span style=\"color: blue;\">eating this rice from Aravan's face</span>, recovered after the ceremony, can induce pregnancy.[86]...one of the actors, believed to be possessed by Kali, <span style=\"color: blue;\">kills a rooster over the statue's neck, </span>symbolizing the sacrifice. Again, <span style=\"color: blue;\">blood-soaked rice is distributed to devotees, </span>especially childless women.[87] Similar rituals associated with a symbolic sacrifice and blood-soaked rice are performed in Melaccari,[88] Alantur, Punamalli and Villupuram. At Alantur and Punamalli, a <span style=\"color: blue;\">goat is sacrificed,</span> in Cuddalore, Patirikkuppam and Villupuram, a cock is sacrificed.[89]<br />\n<br />\n#################################<br />\n<br />\nRSS WILL ONLY MAKE HINDUS AND MUSLIMS FIGHT. position: relative;\">\n<div class=\"comment-header\" id=\"bc_0_36M\" kind=\"m\" style=\"margin: 0px 0px 8px;\">\n<cite class=\"user\" style=\"font-style: normal; font-weight: bold;\"><a href=\"https://www.blogger.com/profile/00048169602292141369\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration-line: none;\">Arun Dixit</a></cite><span class=\"icon user\" style=\"font-weight: bold;\"></span><span class=\"datetime secondary-text\" style=\"margin-left: 6px;\"><a href=\"https://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2013/05/kalpa-vigraha-vishnu-idol-carbon-dated.html?showComment=1492517455989#c6176241155999069892\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration-line: none;\">April 18, 2017 at 5:40 PM</a></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-content\" id=\"bc_0_36MC\" style=\"margin-bottom: 8px; text-align: justify;\">\nThe point of singularity is the navel of Vishnu or the Bindu in Shri Yantra (Shri is the name of Lakshmi). the Universe is getting created out of navel in the form of a lotus stem and then it blossoms. Hence, you can allegorically see the Brhma is at top of lotus flower created the world.</div>\n<span class=\"comment-actions secondary-text\" id=\"bc_0_36MN\" kind=\"m\"><span class=\"item-control blog-admin pid-1040685652\" style=\"display: inline;\"><a href=\"https://www.blogger.com/delete-comment.g?blogID=3564735312144269387&amp;postID=6176241155999069892\" o=\"d\" style=\"color: #888888; padding-right: 5px; padding-top: 5px; text-decoration-line: none;\" target=\"_self\">Delete</a></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-replies\" id=\"bc_0_36BR\" style=\"margin-left: 36px; margin-top: 1em;\">\n</div>\n<div class=\"comment-replybox-single\" id=\"bc_0_36B_box\" style=\"margin-left: 48px; margin-top: 5px;\">\n</div>\n</li>\n<li class=\"comment\" id=\"bc_0_37B\" kind=\"b\" style=\"background-color: #eeeeee; border-bottom: 0px; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; margin: 0px 0px 16px; padding: 0.25em 0px 0px;\"><div class=\"avatar-image-container\" style=\"float: left; font-size: 16px; margin: 0.2em 0px 0px; max-height: 36px; overflow: hidden; width: 36px;\">\n<img src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-57G2xiZ-5tM/WJwrrVpmOmI/AAAAAAABQqo/-9wsspdm4RAiWSVRYXpBpkgoVBQdEyLRQCK4B/s35/*\" style=\"border: 1px solid rgb(238, 238, 238); max-width: 36px;\" /></div>\n<div class=\"comment-block\" id=\"c2929516685189837199\" style=\"margin-left: 48px; position: relative;\">\n<div class=\"comment-header\" id=\"bc_0_37M\" kind=\"m\" style=\"font-size: 16px; margin: 0px 0px 8px;\">\n<cite class=\"user blog-author\" style=\"font-style: normal; font-weight: bold;\"><a href=\"https://www.blogger.com/profile/14410812789424637654\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration-line: none;\">Capt. Ajit Vadakayil</a></cite><span class=\"icon user blog-author\" style=\"background-image: url(&quot;data:image/png; background-repeat: no-repeat; display: inline-block; font-weight: bold; height: 18px; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">7000 years ago it was written in the Vedas\nthat vibrations create matter.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">The Nyaya-Vaiseshika Sutras stated that \u2013<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">---Space-time is a frame in which the\nphysical universe exists<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">---Energy and mass are equivalent.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">---Except Akasha (ether), all of the physical\nelements are made of discreet and distinct paramanus or atoms<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Scientists will take another 500 years to\ndiscovered the wonders of Casimir Effect, an unusual force acting on the\nsmallest of particles ( nano ) due to ZERO POINT FIELD ( akasha ) of brahmAn.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Crystal's pattern need not be in &nbsp;space, but in time, which can allow for the\ncrystal to be in PERPETUAL MOTION ( power of brahman ). Once set in motion, a\ntime crystal could remain in motion forever, with no outside force needed to\nkeep it going.. &nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Crystals, such as diamond\nand quartz, are made of atoms arranged in a repeating pattern in space. In\nthese new crystals, atoms also follow a repeating pattern, but in time. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">VEDAS HAD A LAUGH WHEN THE WHITE MAN WAS SURPRISED\nAT THE POWER WITHIN AN ATOM WITHIN SPACE <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: x-large; line-height: 200%;\">Perpetual motion machines, which are machines\nthat can work indefinitely without an energy source, are forbidden by the laws\nof physics\u2014because these <b style=\"background-color: white;\"><span style=\"color: red;\">CUNTS </span></b>do not know the power of brahman. &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: large; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; line-height: 200%;\"><span style=\"background-color: white; font-size: x-large;\">These <span style=\"color: red;\"><b>CUNTS</b></span> do NOT know that the perpetual motion\ninside an atom is kept alive by Mobius coil pattern of electrons ( <span style=\"color: blue;\"><b>micro scale</b></span> ) with such exact precision that if one electron jumps orbit, the element changes .</span><span style=\"font-size: 14pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2016/12/perpetual-motion-of-orbiting-electrons.html\" style=\"background-color: lime; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">OK--</span><br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">WHAT WAS THE BIGGEST SHOCK AND AWE FACTOR OF BREAKING BAD TV SERIES</span><br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">I DID NOT EVEN MENTION THIS NO 1 FACTOR IN MY ENTIRE REVIEW-- AND DITTO WITH 2, 3 AND 4.</span><br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">I AM A CHEMICAL MAN--AND HENCE FOR ME THIS IS NOT SHOCK AND AWE--I KNOW THE MEANING OF HOMOASSOCIATION OF CONCENTRATED HF</span><br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">ONLY A PLASTIC DRUM CAN HOLD THIS ACID ..IT MELTS EVERYTHING ELSE&nbsp;</span><br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"color: red; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">ON SHIPS WE USE POLYPROPYLENE MOORING ROPES ( HAWSERS ) TO TIE UP THE SHIP TO THE QUAY--IT CANNOT BE ATTACKED BY CONCENTRATED ACIDS AND ALKALIES .. ONLY ULTRAVIOLET OF YEARS OF DIRECT SUNLIGHT CAN DEGRADE THIS .</span><br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">IN SAMUDRA MANTHAN SHIVA DRINK UP OF THE POLYMERISED TOXINS . &nbsp; AS SOON AS HE TOOK ONE GULP WIFE PARVATI PANICKED POUNCED ON HIM, AND PRESSED HIS NECK TILL IT BECAME BLUE--SHIVA IS ALSO KNOWN AS NEELAKANTHAN ( BLUE THROATED )</span><br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">POISON SPILLED OUT AND THE REST HUMPED BULL NANDI JUMPED FORWARD LAPPED UP</span><br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; ( CARVE OUT ISRAEL )<br />\n<span style=\"color: red;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"color: red;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2013/02/the-indian-navy-mutiny-of-1946-only-war.html</span><br />\n<br />\nIrawati Karve was the wife of Dinkar Dhondo Karve wo was the son of Jew Rothschild\u2019s agent Chitpavan Jew Dhondo Keshav Karve ( MAHARISHI KARVE ).<br />\n<br />\nIN SCI I WAS CAPTAIN OF THE HUGE TANKER MAHARISHI KARVE IN 1984\u2014<br />\n<br />\nEVEN THOSE DAYS IN KNEW WHO MAHARISHI KARVE WAS. ROTHSCHILD MADE THE MEAN JEW MAHARISHI.<br />\n<br />\nI HAVE WRITTEN ABOUT THIS FELLOW MAHARISHI KARVE IN MY POST BELOW-<br />\n<span style=\"color: red;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"color: red;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2014/02/devadasi-system-immoral-lie-of-temple.html</span><br />\n<br />\nMaharishi Karve ( Dhondo Keshav Karve) was converted into a saint , and he was running a destitute women\u2019s institution , from which he took his own wife and also provided \u201cnautch girls\u201d to the white men ?<br />\n<br />\nThe Government of India awarded Chitpavan Brahmin Maharishi Dhondo Keshav Karve its highest civilian award, the Bharat Ratna, in 1958. Bharat Ratna was given to Maharshi Dhondo Keshav Karve, because he worked overtime to provide shelter to destitute Indian women.<br />\n<br />\nMaharishi Karve founded an educational institution, Hindu Widows Home, in 1896 with Jew Rothschild\u2019s help.<br />\n<br />\nParvatibai Athavale, a beautiful young widow was the first inmate \u2013she went to USA and all over Europe on Rothschild\u2019s ships \u2013dressing NOT like a widow but an unmarried woman loaded with gold jewellery and colourful sarees.<br />\n<br />\nParvatibai Athavale has penned down her autobiography, later translated in English by Justin E. Abbott and published in 1930, by the name of My Story: The Autobiography of a Hindu Widow<br />\n<br />\nDurga Bhagwat ( one of the most respected women of integrity in India ) has written a damning indictment of Maharishi Karve, alleging that he\u2014<br />\n<br />\n-- \u201c preyed on young attractive women who were vulnerable, facing hard times, and tried to put them under debt of gratitude so that they would be drawn into his coterie for life, looking heartlessly upon them as possible recruits in his social mission \u201c.<br />\n<br />\nDurga was a real Durga as she had refused to accept bullsh#it honors like Padma Shree and Jnanapeeth. She was a very attractive woman in her young age-- never married.<br />\n<br />\nIRAWATI KARVE WAS SPONSORED BY JW ROTHSCHILD\u2014WITH PROSE MATERIAL AND FAALTHU PUBLICITY .<br />\n<br />\nLet me quote Wikipedia\u2014about Irawati baby.<br />\n<br />\nQUOTE: After Karve's death, Durga Bhagwat, a contemporary Marathi intellectual who had also studied under Ghurye but left the course, wrote a scathing critique of Karve. Sundar summarises this as containing \"charges of plagiarism, careerism, manipulation of persons, suppressing the work of others, etc. Whatever the truth of these charges, the essay does Bhagwat little credit.\"[10] UNQUOTE<br />\n<br />\nJew Rothschild gave Irawati Karve a doctorate in Anthropology from Germany in 1928\u2014though she knew SHIT on the subject.<br />\n<br />\nWE WILL WATCH MT VASUDEVAN NAIR.<br />\n<br />\nMAHABHARATA IS A REVERED EPIC. Crystal's pattern need not be in space, but in time, which can allow for the crystal to be in PERPETUAL MOTION ( power of brahman ). Once set in motion, a time crystal could remain in motion forever, with no outside force needed to keep it going.. Crystals, such as diamond and quartz, are made of atoms arranged in a repeating pattern in space. In these new crystals, atoms also follow a repeating pattern, but in time.UNQUOTE<br />\n<br />\nSOMEBODY ASKED ME<br />\n<br />\nWHAT THE HELL THIS PARA IS ALL ABOUT<br />\n<br />\nWELL -- PEOPLE HAVE ASKED ME--WHY IS BRAHMA NEVER WORSHIPED IN INDIA.<br />\n<br />\nBRAHMA WAS WORSHIPED IN INDIA --<br />\n<br />\n<b style=\"font-size: 16px;\"><span style=\"color: red;\">ALL BRAHMA IDOLS HAS A THIRD EYE KNOWS A \"BRAHMAs THIRD EYE\"</span></b><br />\n<b style=\"font-size: 16px;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br />THIS WAS BASICALLY A \"TIME CRYSTAL\" -- A DIAMOND WHICH CHANGES COLOUR</span></b><br />\n<br />\nWHAT THE ISLAMIC INVADER FAILED TO STEAM--THE WHITE MAN STOLE<br />\n<br />\nSO WHAT IS THIS CHAMELEON DIAMOND --NAY-- TIME CRYSTAL ?<br />\n<br />\nA time crystal is a state of matter--which will take the western world another 500 years to come to terms with.<br />\n<br />\nIt has an atomic structure which stretches atoms apart while still allowing them to interact with each other.<br />\n<br />\nThis assymetric structure still repeats itself in space\u2014and also in TIME .<br />\n<br />\nThe assymetric vibrations repeat themselves, perpetually. />\n<br />\nA new god was proclaimed and \"officially\" ratified by Constantine (Acta Concilii Nicaeni, 1618).<br />\n<br />\nThat purely political act of deification effectively and legally placed Hesus and Krishna among the Roman gods as one individual composite.<br />\n<br />\nJESUS CHRIST THUS CAME TO EXISTENCE<br />\n<br />\nJESUS CHRIST WAS DEPICTED ONLY A CROSS N CHURCHES ONLY 1148 YEARS TRYING ON A TREE<br />\n<br />\nEVIL POPE LIED FURTHER --THAT HESUS AND ODIN ( SHUKRACHARYA ) WERE PATRONS OF SAILORS AND WHO NEEDED HUMAN SACRIFICES BY HANGING ..<br />\n<br font-size: 16.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">ALREADY\nWE ARE THE NO 3 POWER ON THIS PLANET<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 16.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 16.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">The white\nman was most sarcastic with our Vishnu Avatars <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 16.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">The\nten Vishnu Avatars are:<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 16.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">1.\nMatsya (the fish) <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 16.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">2.\nKoorma (the tortoise)<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 16.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">3.\nVaraha (the boar)<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 16.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">4.\nNarasimha (the human-lion)<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 16.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">5.\nVamana (the dwarf)<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 16.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">6.\nParasurama (the angry man, Rama with an axe)<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 16.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">7.\nLord Rama (the perfect man, king of Ayodha)<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 16.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">8.\nLord Krishna (the divine statesman) <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 16.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">9.\nLord Ayyappa.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 16.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">10.\nKalki (the mighty warrior)--the FINAL avatar<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 16.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">AVATAR\nNO 1- DOLPHIN<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 16.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 16.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">It was\nabout <span style=\"background-color: yellow;\">consciousness </span>. &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 16.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 16.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Dolphin can pass\nthe mirror and colour test which can be passed only by humans and couple of animals\nlike elephants and bonobos.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 16.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 16.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Only conscious mammals can think clearly and make\nplans.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 16.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 16.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">India ruled the whole planet before 7000 BC. (each\nnumber is the sum of the previous two). The ratio of successive pairs is\nso-called golden section - 1.618033989 . . . . .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">A golden rectangle is a rectangle whose side\nlengths are in the golden ratio, 1: 1.618. whose reciprocal is 0.618033989 . .\n. . . so that we have 1/G = 1 + G.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">The <span style=\"background-color: yellow;\">Golden Ratio</span> is thus a universal law in\nwhich is contained the ground-principle of all formative striving for beauty\nand completeness in the realms of nature art, structures, forms and\nproportions, whether cosmic or individual, organic or inorganic, acoustic or\noptical\u2014and of course in the perfect human form.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">The Sri Yantra is drawn using the golden mean\n( 1.618 ) as shown in the video below. font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Hindu god Brahman is within the atom giving perpetual\nmotion is figure of eight Mobius coil arbits<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2016/12/perpetual-motion-of-orbiting-electrons.html\" style=\"background-color: lime;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2016/12/perpetual-motion-of-orbiting-electrons.html</a><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">When you blow a conch your body must be\nerect, as per the spirit level in the inner ear cochlea, to balance right and\nleft brain lobes. The spiral in the inner ear also follows the Fibonacci\nseries.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Scalar waves and sound waves are\nLONGITUDINAL.&nbsp; Rest are all transverse.\nSpirals which follow the Golden mean and Fibonacci series can create scalar\nwaves.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Which means a conch can create scalar\nwaves.&nbsp; The sound of the sea when you\nlisten to the conch held to your ear is the sound of the <span style=\"background-color: yellow;\">Zero Point Field </span>or\nScalar Field or Brahman or OM.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Lord Shiva is also known as Shankara. He\ndrank up the polymerized poison after Samudra Manthan using his conch.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">EVERY HINDU GOD IS A COSMIC ALLEGORY EXCEPT\nVISHNUs LATER HUMAN AVATARS . &nbsp; &nbsp;THESE MORTALS WITH 13 STRAND DNA AND&nbsp; MORE&nbsp; SUBMITTED\nTO THE LAWS OF KARMA.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Halayudha ( 300 BC ) a Kerala mathematician\nwrote the M\u1e5btasa\u00f1j\u012bvan\u012b, &nbsp;a commentary on Pingala's Chanda\u1e25\u015b\u0101stra ( 500 BC\n. &nbsp; The latter contains a clear description of Pascal's triangle (called\n<span style=\"background-color: white;\">meru</span>-prastaara).&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; line-height: 200%;\"><b><span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-size: large;\">Meru represents Pascal\u2019s\ntriangle.</span></b><span style=\"font-size: 14pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; line-height: 200%;\"><b><span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-size: large;\"><br /></span></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-Gv0xxDon5IE/WPMzgwuDxeI/AAAAAAABSnE/fejfaQq0OT0t5iQTtqoIe1SCL7dwVeZPgCLcB/s1600/250px-PascaldTriangleAnimated2.gif\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-Gv0xxDon5IE/WPMzgwuDxeI/AAAAAAABSnE/fejfaQq0OT0t5iQTtqoIe1SCL7dwVeZPgCLcB/s1600/250px-PascaldTriangleAnimated2.gif\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">MUCH BEFORE KERALA MATHEMATICIAN VARAHAMIHIRA\n2660 BC EXPOUNDED THIEF PASCALS TRIANGLE WHICH HAS FIBONACCI SERIES INHERENT. &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-OhyKjEBJcqE/WPNIu4QeaoI/AAAAAAABSpc/czr6SbHcGjwDeEh9cmsBcObK6xVdfQ-kwCLcB/s1600/goldszen-mean-spiral2e4-300x239.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"509\" src=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-OhyKjEBJcqE/WPNIu4QeaoI/AAAAAAABSpc/czr6SbHcGjwDeEh9cmsBcObK6xVdfQ-kwCLcB/s640/goldszen-mean-spiral2e4-300x239.jpg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: cyan;\"><span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif;\"><span style=\"font-size: 18.6667px;\">Below: &nbsp;</span></span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">When you look at\nPascal's Triangle, find the prime numbers that are the first number in the row.\nThat prime number is a divisor of every number in that row.</span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-H2Oig3kzT_g/WPM0ABSJnRI/AAAAAAABSnM/8IkQrv0Z7hQ9s8W5sYIMniPletO1ihfCACLcB/s1600/pZascals2.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"632\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-H2Oig3kzT_g/WPM0ABSJnRI/AAAAAAABSnM/8IkQrv0Z7hQ9s8W5sYIMniPletO1ihfCACLcB/s640/pZascals2.jpg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: cyan; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: cyan; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\"></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"background-color: cyan;\">Below:&nbsp; Powers of 2-- the sum of the numbers is Row 0\nis 1 or 2^0. &nbsp;&nbsp;Similiarly, in Row 1, the\nsum of the numbers is 1+1 = 2 = 2^1. If you will look at each row down to row\n15, you will see that this is true. In fact, if Pascal's triangle was expanded\nfurther past Row 15, you would see that the sum of the numbers of any nth row\nwould equal to 2^n</span><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"background-color: cyan;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-RcJ82iU1kBc/WPM0kSdeBqI/AAAAAAABSnU/PyV3IzWloPESGfmnM8zKLOAgCAghcWqDACLcB/s1600/pzzascals3.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"516\" src=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-RcJ82iU1kBc/WPM0kSdeBqI/AAAAAAABSnU/PyV3IzWloPESGfmnM8zKLOAgCAghcWqDACLcB/s640/pzzascals3.jpg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: cyan; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Below-- Magic 11's-&nbsp; Each row represent the numbers in the powers\nof 11 (carrying over the digit if it is not a single number). For example, the\nnumbers in row 4 are 1, 4, 6, 4, and 1 and 11^4 is equal to 14,641. Look at row\n5. The numbers in row 5 are 1, 5, 10, 10, 5, and 1. Since 10 has two digits,\nyou have to carry over, so you would get 161,051 which is equal to 11^5.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-H0fHLzszB6g/WPM1MXrwniI/AAAAAAABSnc/HQhJnEn3j1cDtPeMpJKrfHDITP8MsOPYwCLcB/s1600/bbz1.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"596\" src=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-H0fHLzszB6g/WPM1MXrwniI/AAAAAAABSnc/HQhJnEn3j1cDtPeMpJKrfHDITP8MsOPYwCLcB/s640/bbz1.jpg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">\n\n</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"background-color: cyan;\">Below: Hockey Stick\nPattern-&nbsp; Start with any number in\nPascal's Triangle and proceed down the diagonal. Then change the direction in\nthe diagonal for the last number. That last number is the sum of every other\nnumber in the diagonal.</span><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"background-color: cyan;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-hzxKdCXzEgQ/WPM1-UeXV1I/AAAAAAABSnk/Q1fepoXfuUAk6cLwpz3poaTSfhAR8078wCLcB/s1600/7z2.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"554\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-hzxKdCXzEgQ/WPM1-UeXV1I/AAAAAAABSnk/Q1fepoXfuUAk6cLwpz3poaTSfhAR8078wCLcB/s640/7z2.jpg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"background-color: cyan;\">Below-&nbsp; Triangular Numbers- If you start with row 2\nand start with 1, the diagonal contains the triangular numbers.</span><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"background-color: cyan;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-7cXbTuw69YI/WPM2VNgB2kI/AAAAAAABSno/a351YHTzcgENsDHK_KSSSRDK1h6m4TfcwCLcB/s1600/4tty.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"634\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-7cXbTuw69YI/WPM2VNgB2kI/AAAAAAABSno/a351YHTzcgENsDHK_KSSSRDK1h6m4TfcwCLcB/s640/4tty.jpg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"background-color: cyan;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"background-color: cyan;\">Below-&nbsp; Square Numbers--Down the diagonal, as\npictured to the right, are the square numbers. You can find them by summing 2\nnumbers together. This can be done by starting with 0+1=1=1^2 (in figure 1),\nthen 1+3=4=2^2 (figure 2), 3+6 = 9=3^2 (in figure 1), and so on.&nbsp; Note that these are represented in 2 figures\nto make it easy to see the 2 numbers that are being summed.</span><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"background-color: cyan;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-_mhqJZJjA2o/WPM23aTsGfI/AAAAAAABSnw/f_Fyi0dn0oEjtDXaT9Cer8PQj0odkYCRACLcB/s1600/parrscals8.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"636\" src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-_mhqJZJjA2o/WPM23aTsGfI/AAAAAAABSnw/f_Fyi0dn0oEjtDXaT9Cer8PQj0odkYCRACLcB/s640/parrscals8.jpg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"background-color: cyan;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-se6EI_mDjSo/WPM27CZTwgI/AAAAAAABSn0/0HjCCng6oCsMdWNPTBl9aSx2cTapYSQkgCLcB/s1600/pzzascals9.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"632\" src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-se6EI_mDjSo/WPM27CZTwgI/AAAAAAABSn0/0HjCCng6oCsMdWNPTBl9aSx2cTapYSQkgCLcB/s640/pzzascals9.jpg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"background-color: cyan;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"background-color: cyan;\"><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif;\">Below- &nbsp;Fibonacci's Sequence-- If you take the sum of the shallow diagonal, you will get the Fibonacci numbers.</span></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"background-color: cyan;\"><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif;\"><br /></span></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-8IJy104KtN0/WPM3NJxMqtI/AAAAAAABSn4/gEOczlBifeANFS_M9T2OVN_Q58wuAWmvQCLcB/s1600/3wz.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"630\" src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-8IJy104KtN0/WPM3NJxMqtI/AAAAAAABSn4/gEOczlBifeANFS_M9T2OVN_Q58wuAWmvQCLcB/s640/3wz.jpg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"line-height: 150%;\"></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"background-color: cyan;\">Below- Catalan Numbers--\nCatalan numbers are found by taking polygons, and finding how many ways they\ncan be partitianed into triangles. These numbers are found in Pascal's triangle\nby starting in the 3 row of Pascal's triangle down the middle and subtracting\nthe number adjacent to it.</span><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-2weDzqMiI2Q/WPM3n_KEqaI/AAAAAAABSn8/-aoTMYk36sQJzcu6v9imh4PIlZA8ZQ0eQCLcB/s1600/pascaldzs10.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"634\" src=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-2weDzqMiI2Q/WPM3n_KEqaI/AAAAAAABSn8/-aoTMYk36sQJzcu6v9imh4PIlZA8ZQ0eQCLcB/s640/pascaldzs10.jpg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"></span></div>\n<table align=\"center\" border=\"1\" style=\"color: black; font-family: Georgia, &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 18px; width: 200px;\"><tbody>\n<tr><td align=\"center\" valign=\"middle\">Number of Sides</td><td align=\"center\" valign=\"middle\">Number of Ways to Partitian</td><td align=\"center\" valign=\"middle\"></td></tr>\n<tr><td align=\"center\" valign=\"middle\">3</td><td align=\"center\" valign=\"middle\">1</td><td align=\"center\" valign=\"middle\"><img src=\"http://jwilson.coe.uga.edu/EMAT6680Su12/Berryman/6690/BerrymanK-Pascals/pascals11a.jpg\" height=\"50\" kasperskylab_antibanner=\"on\" width=\"62\" /></td></tr>\n<tr><td align=\"center\" valign=\"middle\">4</td><td align=\"center\" valign=\"middle\">2</td><td align=\"center\" valign=\"middle\"><img src=\"http://jwilson.coe.uga.edu/EMAT6680Su12/Berryman/6690/BerrymanK-Pascals/pascals11b.jpg\" height=\"48\" kasperskylab_antibanner=\"on\" width=\"97\" /></td></tr>\n<tr><td align=\"center\" valign=\"middle\">5</td><td align=\"center\" valign=\"middle\">5</td><td align=\"center\" valign=\"middle\"><img src=\"http://jwilson.coe.uga.edu/EMAT6680Su12/Berryman/6690/BerrymanK-Pascals/pascals11c.jpg\" height=\"50\" kasperskylab_antibanner=\"on\" width=\"261\" /></td></tr>\n<tr><td align=\"center\" valign=\"middle\">6</td><td align=\"center\" valign=\"middle\">14</td><td align=\"center\" valign=\"middle\"><img src=\"http://jwilson.coe.uga.edu/EMAT6680Su12/Berryman/6690/BerrymanK-Pascals/pascals11d.jpg\" height=\"100\" kasperskylab_antibanner=\"on\" width=\"365\" /></td></tr>\n</tbody></table>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: cyan; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: cyan; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: cyan; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Below:&nbsp; Binomial Expansion --When expanding a\nbionomial equation, the coeffiecents can be found in Pascal's triangle. For\nexample, if you are expanding (x+y)^8, you would look at the 8th row to know\nthat these digits are the coeffiencts of your answer. This is true for (x+y)^n.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-7EhJWAdZbKE/WPM4VlWiyqI/AAAAAAABSoE/-UGevHuprEYirMDcZVnZ_rySO8-hm-iGACLcB/s1600/eez5.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"630\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-7EhJWAdZbKE/WPM4VlWiyqI/AAAAAAABSoE/-UGevHuprEYirMDcZVnZ_rySO8-hm-iGACLcB/s320/eez5.jpg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: cyan; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: cyan; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"background-color: cyan;\">Below: Fractal--&nbsp; If you shade all the even numbers, you will\nget a fractal. This is also the recursive of Sierpinski's Triangle.</span><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">During the Mahabharata\nwar 4000 BC,&nbsp; Arjuna had sworn to kill\nJayadratha before sunset failing which he will commit suicide.&nbsp; The Kaurava army was successful in keeping\nArjuna away from Jayadratha and sunset was nearing.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">So Lord Krishna (\navatar of Vishnu ) unleashed his Sudarshana Chakra in scalar interferometry\nmode , which created an severe inversion in the atmosphere.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The atmospheric\nrefraction reversed , and the sun suddenly dipped below the visible horizon\ncausing absolute darkness.&nbsp; At this time\nthere was a mighty cheer among the Kaurava ranks and Jayadratha peered out of\nhis tent in triumph and relief.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">As per the rules of\nDharma Yuddha it is NOT possible to kill an enemy after sunset.&nbsp; As soon as Krishna saw Jayadratha he\ncommanded Arjuna to behead him with an arrow and immediately restored the\natmospheric refraction the usual way.&nbsp;\nThe sun suddenly came up above the visible horizon.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">After beheading\nJayadrata, his head was delivered to the lap of his father Viddhakshatra's lap,\nmeditating hundreds of miles away, in the cruise missile drone mode.. &nbsp;&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-uOpL0L3xxD4/WPOCRfu3K8I/AAAAAAABSqA/yHA42Yco-gcnEnKE83lwmZDaCqXPzhpQQCLcB/s1600/dowEnload.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em;
