, &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2017/04/sanatana-dharma-hinduism-exhumed-and_1.html\" style=\"background-color: lime;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2017/04/sanatana-dharma-hinduism-exhumed-and_1.html</a><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">However, the unheard\ncosmic sounds, the symphony of Shabda-Brahman, was heard by the 12 stranded\nVedic Maharishis in their spiritual trances and is enshrined in the Upanishads\nas the syllable.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">OM is the quintessence,\nthe seed-syllable of the universe.&nbsp; Mantra\nis the sound-body of consciousness.&nbsp;&nbsp; Our\n7000 year old Vedas say that matter is created from vibrations.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Yoga Shiksha\nUpanishad says: \u201cThat indestructible transcendent vibrating sound is\nShabda-Brahman.\u201d<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Nada yoga&nbsp; is an ancient Indian metaphysical system\nwhich is based on the premise that the entire cosmos and all that exists in the\ncosmos, including human beings, consists of sound vibrations, called nada.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This concept holds that it is the sound\nenergy in motion rather than of matter and particles which form the building\nblocks of the cosmos.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Matter is created by\nvibrations.&nbsp; On a macro scale everything\nis longitudinal sound.&nbsp;&nbsp; On a micro scale\nevery disease is musical disharmony.&nbsp;&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Primal sound is&nbsp; referred to as Shabda Brahman - \"God as\nword\".&nbsp; Closely related to this is\nthe concept of Nada Brahman - \"God as sound\".</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Just in case you wonder\nwhat is SHABDA and what is NADA \u2013 the former is masculine connoting artha (\nmeaning ) while the latter is feminine signifying the voiced sound . <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Music is Nada.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The fundamental\nstructure of the universe is based on Nada or sound vibrations.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A mantra in its purest\nform , the inner power , is a manifestation of Nada.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The movement of prana (\nenergy )&nbsp; in the body is an expression of\nNada.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Nada is the celestial\nmusic within us. The word Nada is derived from the Sanskrit root nad, meaning\n\u201cunion through sound.\u201d</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Again, Nada refers to\nthe vibrations which make up the sound.&nbsp;\nShabda refers to a discreet sound, separate from the meaning it conveys.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Nada Yogi&nbsp; sees the whole macrocosmic and microcosmic\nworld as made up of sound. The Nada Yogi experiences the macrocosmic universe\nas a projection of sound vibrations; the whole world as having developed from\nsound alone.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Nada means not only\nsound, but energy, flow and pitch.&nbsp; Thus\nNada Yoga,&nbsp; in a deeper sense is the\nscience of vibration.&nbsp; Quantum physics\nagrees with our 7000 year old Vedas that vibration (sound) is the essence of\nall forms in the creation.&nbsp; Sound vibration\nbrings into being the visual world of forms.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Indian classical music\nis nada yoga, where the music is rendered absolutely scientific and classical\nin order to experience the nada.&nbsp; The\ndevelopment of Indian classical musical systems in the past was done strictly\nin accordance with the views of nada yoga sadhanas.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The 7000 year old Sama Veda\nis always sung with a scientific exactness and in accordance with nada yoga\nsadhana.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In the ancient wisdom\nof the Sanatana Dharma, the medium of creation is conscious sound\nvibration.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\"By His utterance\ncame the universe.\" <b>(Brihadaranyaka Upanishad 1.2.4) 5000 BC.</b><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Now Nada also contains\nsounds beyond the human audible range. But these sounds were perceptible to a\n12 strand DNA maharishi.&nbsp; Nada is the\nsound that exists in all Kundalini Chakras.&nbsp;\nIn the heart it exists as Anahata (unstruck sound). &nbsp;&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Shabda and Nada\nmanifested in the cosmic energy of sound give rise to the energies of heat,\nlight and other basic streams of energy&nbsp;\nexisting in the universe.&nbsp; The\nNada (cosmic vibration) of the Shabda (eternal sound) is the originator of\neverything that exists in nature.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When a damaru is\nvibrated, it produces dissimilar sounds which are fused together by resonance\nto create one single sound&nbsp; .&nbsp; When the Damaru is twisted in one revolution,\nit often makes the sounds of three successive tones.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Panini formulated the\nrules of Sanskrit morphology, syntax and semantics in fourteen verses, from\nthe&nbsp; sounds of Lord Shiva's Damaru,\ncalled Maheshwara Sutrani.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">These Sutras\nare also known as A\u1e63\u1e6dadhyayi, meaning eight chapters, the foundational text of\nthe grammatical branch of the Vedanga.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The knowledge of Shabda BrahmAn - Nada BrahmAn is thus the most\nimportant branch of the Indian school of spirituality. .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">It is from this ancient\nVedic wisdom that modern science developed sound engineering. Sound frequencies\nare now being used in modern hospitals&nbsp;\nto stimulate new cellular growth,&nbsp;\nresolve tumors, dissolve calcium deposits, stimulate new neurological\ndevelopment, deliver nourishment, detoxify, resolve paralysis, remove plaque\nand tooth decay, act as a carrier frequency to deliver higher forms of\nknowledge and information, even scan and harvest information.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Sonocytology is the\nstudy of cell sounds.&nbsp; Dead cells with\nlow electrical charge emitted a low rumbling like radio static.&nbsp; Distinguishing between the sound signatures\nof healthy and diseased cells WILL be a part of the medicine of the\nfuture.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Reiki wave ( originated\nin India ) &nbsp;deals with a DNA created longitudinal\nwave called scalar wave , faster than light, and which cannot be trapped by\nFaradays\u2019s cage. Sound operates through the law of Resonance. Resonance\neliminates the limitations of the \"sender and receiver dynamic.\"&nbsp; Resonance is where two become one, where\nminds join.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Resonance is, in\nitself, a state of awareness and experiential knowing far beyond concept and\nmental, cognitive thinking. On the vibration field-form-body-time level,\nresonance is the experiential state of Oneness.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; line-height: 150%;\">The Beeja mantras are\none-syllable seed sounds that, when said aloud, activate the energy of the\nchakras in order to purify and balance the mind and body.&nbsp;&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When you utter beeja\nmantras, you resonate with the energy of the associated chakra.-- as mentioned\nin the&nbsp; Jabala Darsana Upanishad in 5000\nBC. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Ham, Yam, Ram, Vam and\nLam are the panch bhoota mantras.&nbsp;&nbsp; The\nfive elements evolve from the five tanamatras (principals); earth from gandha\n(smell), water from rasa (taste), fire from rupa (sight), air from sparsha\n(touch) and akasha from shabda (hearing).<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Every Beej mantra\ncreates a huMMMMMMMM, which produces the magic molecule Nitric Oxide. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Nitric oxide is a gas\nthat affects blood vessels.&nbsp; It is a\nsimple molecule, having two atoms - nitrogen and oxygen.&nbsp; But it does an incredible array of\nthings.&nbsp; Our blood vessels make nitric\noxide. It's a potent and facile dilator. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When the human body\nreaches the age of 27 years, the secretion of nitric oxide is at its peak. As\nyou get&nbsp; older and the production of\nnitric oxide in the human body declines gradually, more from age 42 onwards. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Nitric oxide controls\nblood flow in our body.&nbsp; It controls our\nvascular resistance , the blood pressure . When your body produces sufficient\namounts of Nitric oxide, then your blood vessels are relaxed, and your blood\npressure is low.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Conversely if you're\nnot making enough or Nitric Oxide production is inactivated,&nbsp; then&nbsp;\nyour blood vessels become contracted and your blood pressure shoots up.&nbsp; So this is an important feature of the blood\nvessels is its&nbsp; ability to control its\nown diameter automatically. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Nitric oxide is part of\nthe body's self-defense mechanism.It can defend against bacteria.&nbsp; It also defends against tumor cells.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Nitric Oxide in higher concentrations can\nactually halt the growth of cells or can halt bacterial growth, so it's a\ndefense against infection. Macrophages, certain cells of the immune system,\nproduce Nitric oxide in order to kill invading bacteria.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">By adopting digital\nSanskrit as a computer language it is possible to create conscious computers\nwhich can laugh at a genuine joke, or tell the moral of a story like \u201c haste is\nwaste\u201d.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">It is the only\nunambiguous computer language suitable for N-GRAM NLP and AskMSR.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Astadhyayi, presented\nthe processes of phonology, morphology and syntax, and laid down the basis for\ncenturies of commentaries and expositions by Sanskrit grammarians who followed.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Panini's approach was\namazingly formal; his production rules for deriving complex structures and\nsentences represent resemble those of modern computer languages.&nbsp; Many of the developments in Indian\nMathematics, especially the place value notation system may have originated\nfrom Paninian analysis.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Panini's grammar\nconsists of four parts:-<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u015aivas\u016btra: phonology\n(notations for phonemes specified in 14 lines)<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A\u1e63\u1e6dadhy\u0101y\u012b: morphology\n(construction rules for complexes)<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Dh\u0101tup\u0101\u1e6dha: list of\nroots (classes of verbal roots)<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Ga\u1e47ap\u0101\u1e6dha: lists\nclasses of primitive nominal stems<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In the Shiva Sutras,\nPanini discusses something like the concepts of the phoneme, the morpheme and\nthe root.&nbsp; The Shiva Sutras describe a\nphonemic notational system in the opening part of the Astadhyayi.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The notational system introduces different\nclusters of phonemes that serve special roles in the morphology of Sanskrit,\nand are referred to throughout the text.&nbsp;\n<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Rigveda stated 7000\nyear ago that speech process has four stages. These four stages are Para,\nPasyanti, Madhyama and Vaikhari.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Shabda brahmAn\nmanifests through his power of maya first as para vani in the mooladhara chakra\nat the perineum, then as pashyanti in the manipura chakra at the navel, next as\nmadhyama in the heart and then eventually as vaikhari in the throat and mouth.\nThis is the divine descent of voice.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The first three are\ninternal and yogic and can be experienced only by seers. The fourth stage is\nVaikhari is the audible speech, which is used by all human beings. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The general perception\nof a layman is that when we speak, sound comes from the throat.&nbsp; But what happens is when we have the urge or\nthe thought to speak, our life force in the form of vaayu, starts from the root\nchakra and brings Paraa, the subtle sound, then travels up to the navel, heart\nchakras as Pasyanti and Madhyamaa respectively, then comes to the throat,\nmouth, teeth and tongue as Vaikhari to come out as speech or sound at the gross\nlevel.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">These four levels of\nsound correspond to four states of consciousness. Paraa represents the\ntranscendental consciousness. Pasyanti represents the intellectual\nconsciousness. Madhyamaa represents the mental consciousness.&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">And Vaikhari\nrepresents the physical consciousness.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Para represents\ntranscendental consciousness. Para is a soundless seed,&nbsp;&nbsp; pure adya shakti from kundalini, beyond name\nand forms.&nbsp; . Para is Adya Shakti.&nbsp;&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">According to Taitreeya\nUpanishad, Aakaasa evolved first.&nbsp; From\nAakaasa evolved Vaayu, from Vayu evolved Agni, from Agni evolved Jala and from\nJala evolved Prithvi.&nbsp; So Aakaasa is\ncalled Param, as it was the first one to form among the five basic elements.\nIts attribute Sabda is called Paraa.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">At the time of\ncreation, this Paraa expressed itself as Bindu or a subtle particle. It is also\ncalled as Kaarana bindu, the cause for all sound manifestations within and\noutside our body. Paraa means the highest or the farthest.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Para vaak is the sound beyond the perception\nof our senses. Paraa is the first stage of sound in its unmanifest stage and is\nthe source of all root ideas and germ thoughts.&nbsp;\n<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">On the stage of\nPara-vaak there is no distinction between the object and the sound. The sound\ncontains within it all the qualities of the object.&nbsp; Nada Yogis claim that Paraa Nada is a high\nfrequency sound, so high that it does not stir or produce any vibrations.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">By the urge of man to talk, with the help of\nvaayu or air, Paraa moves up to the Manipuraka chakra or the navel centre and\ngets transformed into Pasyanti.</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Para means highest or\nfarthest, and in this connection it indicates that sound which is beyond the\nperception of the senses. Para-vak is also known as \"rava-shabda\" -\nan unvibratory condition of sound beyond the reach of mind and intelligence\n(avyakta), only to be realized by great souls, the 12 strand maharishis,\nparama-jnanis. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">On the stage of\npara-vak there is no distinction between the object and the sound. The sound\ncontains within it all the qualities of the object. The highest manifestation\nof sound energy, the primal voice, the divine voice is para.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The para voice\ngives birth to root ideas or germ thoughts. It is the first manifestation of\nvoice. In the para state the sound remains in an undifferentiated form.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Para is pure\nintention.&nbsp; Pure because it is a direct\nexpression of the will of reality, unadulterated by any personal\npreference.&nbsp; Para means transcendental,\n\u2018beyond\u2019 or \u2018the other side\u2019. It is beyond the reach of the indriyas, or sense\norgans, and the mind and other means of cognition.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;Hence para nada is the\ntranscendental sound. It is indicative of a truth that there is a sphere of\nsuper-consciousness where the sound is heard in different dimensions.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Sounds having a very\nhigh frequency are transformed into silence. Beyond a certain limit, the ears\ndo not have the capacity. No one can hear or understand a sound like that even\nif it is present. Para or transcendental sound has the highest vibration\nfrequency.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This intense vibration faculty makes para inaudible. . When a sound\ngoes to its maximum pitch, it attains a sudden stillness, and that is para\nnada.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Pasyanti represents the\nintellectual consciousness, a state of abstract knowledge, like an idea which\nhas not yet been expressed in words.&nbsp;\nPashyanti is the thought form. Pasyanti literally means observing or\nseeing one's self. In the pasyanti stage sound possesses qualities such as\ncolor and form.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When sound goes up to\nthe navel with the bodily air in vibratory form without any particular syllable\n(varna), yet connected with the mind, it is known as Pashyanti-vaak.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Pasyanti observes and\nanalyses her impending changes in the heart, throat and the tongue, where the\nsound finally attains audibility. Within the Pasyanti-vaak exists the nature's\nIccha-shakti, or the power of will.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Pashyanti-vak is the second level of sound, and is less subtle than\npara-vak. Pashyanti in Sanskrit means \"that which can be seen or\nvisualized\".<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Yogis who have inner\nvision can perceive these qualities in sound.&nbsp;\nOn this stage the differences between language do not exist, as this\nsound is intuitive and situated beyond rigidly defined concepts.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">On the stage of pashyanti-vak, speech is\nintuitively connected to the object. There is near oneness between the word and\nthe experience described.&nbsp; Pashyanti-vak\nis the finest impulse of speech. The seat of pashyanti is in the navel or the\nManipura Chakra. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When sound goes up to\nthe naval with the bodily air in vibratory form without any particular syllable\n(varna), yet connected with the mind, it is pashyanti-vak. Within the\npashyanti-vak exists the nature's iccha-shakti, or the power of will.&nbsp; Yogis who have subtle inner vision can\nexperience the pashyanti state of sound.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;Pashyanti does not distinguish between subject\nand object. Perceptible but not yet particularized, it covers the middle ground\nbetween para\u2019s pure intention and madhyama\u2019s verbalized but as yet unspoken\nmental speech.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The second stage of sound, which has less frequency and is more\ngross than para, is pashyanti.&nbsp; It is a\nsound which cannot be heard, but it can be seen. This is why Pashyanti in Sanskrit\nmeans \u2018that which can be seen or visualized\u2019.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Madhyamaa represents\nthe mental consciousness&nbsp; . Pasyanti, on\nreaching the Anaahata chakra or the heart chakra , transforms into Madhyama\nvaak.&nbsp; Madhyamaa literally means in between\nor middle.&nbsp; Here there is a clear\ndistinction between the sound and the object it denotes.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Madhyama vaak is more\nof a mental speech rather than the external audible speech.&nbsp; Within the Madhyama-vaak exists the nature's\nJnana-shakti, or the power of knowledge.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Madhyama-vak is the intermediate unexpressed state of sound, whose seat\nis in the heart.. The middle sound is that sound which exists between the\nstates of susupti and jagrat.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Madhyama is the\nintermediate unexpressed state of sound experienced in the heart. Madhyama is\nmental speech, verbalized but unspoken, the internal monologue and dialogue; it\nexpresses j\u00f1ana shakti, the power of knowledge and wisdom (or lack\nthereof).&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Madhyama measures, evaluates,\nquestions, harnessing your rational and emotional minds to formulate the\nintentions that precipitate into words.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Madhyama is\nparticularized into phonemes, directed to mental objects, the objects of the\ninner senses. It straddles the gulf between the noiseless conviction that is\npashyanti and the spoken word that is vaikhari. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Madhyama is sound\nhaving lower frequencies than para and pashyanti, but still subtler than the\naudible vaikhari form of sound.&nbsp; No\naudible effect is produced in it. Madhyama produces very minute vibrations in\nthe act of a whisper. In an ordinary sound, two objects strike against each other\nin order to produce sound.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">But in\nmadhyama no two things strike violently so as to produce audible sound.&nbsp; The word madhyama means a middle sound, a\nwhispering sound or the sound of a whisper.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Vaikhari represents the\nphysical consciousness, an audible speech manifestation .. Vaikhari resides in\nthe throat chakra.&nbsp; Vaikhari is what we\nspeak through our mouth, which had started from Para.&nbsp; Para is subtle and Vaikhari is manifested\nform of Bhava/sound.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Vaikhari is the&nbsp; sound which has come all the way from the\nroot chakra with the force of vaayu, travels further upwards to the throat,\nmouth, teeth and tongue, to become an articulate sound, audible to the external\near.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When sabda is spoken\nthrough the mouth with the help of syllables, that speech is Vaikhari vak.\nWithin the Vaikhari-vaak exists the nature's Kriya-shakti, or power of action.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Vaikhari-vak is the grossest level of speech, and it is heard through the\nexternal senses. When sound comes out through the mouth as spoken syllables it\nis called as vaikhari. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Vaikhari the\narticulated speech, which, in a waveform, reaches the ears and to the intellect\nof the listener.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Audible vaikhari lies\nwithin the purview of the conscious mind and jagrat (waking-time\nconsciousness). The spoken sound vaikhari is produced by friction or by\nstriking two things against each other.&nbsp;\nIts frequencies of vibration are conducted within a certain limited\nrange. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">mulam adharam arabhya\ndvistkantam upeyusi<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">udita aneka sahasra\nsurya vahnindu sannibha<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">cakravat punar adharat\nsanta pasyatha madhyama<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">vaikhari sthanam\nasadhya tatrasta sthanavartini<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">varnanam jananim bhutva\nbhogya prasnoumi gouriva<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\"Seated in the\narea starting from the muladhara to the position of dvistkanta with effulgence\nequal to the rising of millions of suns, fires and moons. Like a wheel from the\nadhara becoming the sounds known as santa, pashyati, madhyama.&nbsp; Reaching the position of vaikhari, there\nsituated in eight places, viz., the throat etc. Being the mother of all sounds\nI bestow enjoyments like a cow.\"<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Vedas are thus NOT\ncowherd\u2019s verses to while away their time while grazing goats. OM is not the\ncall of a man to summon his wife..<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Vedas when chanted\nthe right way releases the wisdom they contain as real sacred energy that can\n\u201ccreate the spiritual states of mind and of life which the words describe\u201d ,\nand influence the course of human destiny and even the order of the Universe.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Can you believe that\nthe immoral west&nbsp; ( who stole and\npatented our ancient knowledge and then injected poison into the originals&nbsp; or destroyed it&nbsp; ) talks of India in the same breath and same\nsentence along with Mayan, Incas , Aztecs, Hopi, Red Indians, Egyptians,&nbsp; Sumerians,&nbsp;\nMesopotamians BLAH BLAH \u2013 who have left zilch books behind for posterity\n?<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Panini\u2019s grammar covers\nmany features of the language like swara (vowels), vyanjana (consonants) ,\nsandhis (combination of words) , samaas (description diff to put it in a\nbracket) , Prathyaya, (prefixes/suffixes), etc.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: red; font-size: x-large;\">The IMMORAL mouth piece\nof the west has dated Panini as 4th century BC.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: red; font-size: x-large;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: red; font-size: x-large;\">Because the big bang as per the old Bible happened in </span><span style=\"color: blue; font-size: x-large;\"><b>4004 BC</b></span><span style=\"color: red; font-size: x-large;\">.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Vedas and Upanishads followed an oral route\nfor more than 33,000 years before they were penned down 7000 years ago. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The white man was doing\nGRUNT GRUNT for language 5000 years ago.</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Ashtadhyayi of\nPanini consists of&nbsp; 3990 sutras or\naphorisms.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">WE CAN REVIVE SANSKRIT\nIN INDIA BY HAVING COMPULSORY NEWS IN SANSKRIT IN PRIME TIME WITH ENGLISH\nSUBTITLES \u2014 COMPULSORY FOR CABLE&nbsp; VIDEO\nCHANNELS TOO,&nbsp; IF THEY NEED BROADCASTING\nRIGHTS IN INDIA.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Mantras are Scalar\nenergy based sounds which resonate in the Zero Point Field Aakashik hyperspace.\nMantra is a carrier wave with potent information within it.&nbsp; Mantras must begin and end with OM which\nresonates with the earths heartbeat of 7.83 hertz.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Our 7000 year old Vedas say, that all forms\nof reality are sound forms\u2014music\u2014their very substance composed of vibration.\nThis Shabda-brahman is the great cosmic wavelength experienced as God.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The maharishis realized\nBrahman, or \u201ctranscendental consciousness,\u201d in the form of sound. They knew\nthat this transcendental sound, which has no limits and is immeasurable,\nmanifests not only within the vital air known as prana, but also through our\nsenses and even our mind.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">We all know that&nbsp;\nsound is the vehicle for emotion, which we can either reinforce or\nrelease. We sing with joy, shout in anger, cry in sorrow and groan in pain.\nThus each emotion corresponds to a particular kind of sound, and intensified\nemotions usually demand stronger sounds.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">During japa, the whole\nbody vibrates and all other sensations go numb. It\u2019s a beautiful, sensuous\nfeeling that purifies and elevates your entire being to a higher level.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Japa involves the\nmeditative repetition of a mantra. Mantra is mystical energy encapsulated\nwithin a sound structure. Every mantra contains in its vibrations a certain\npower.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Vachika japa: the\nmantra is repeated out loud<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Upamsu japa: the mantra\nis repeated semi-audibly by moving only the tongue and lips<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Manasa japa: the mantra\nis repeated mentally without allowing the tongue and lips to move<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Likhita japa: the\nmantra is written continuously or for a fixed number of times<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Akhanda japa: the\nmantra is repeated for a specific number of times without a break, or for a\nfixed period of time, such as from sunrise to sunset. Akhanda japa is often\nperformed rhythmically and congregationally.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Alapa japa: the mantra\nis repeated mentally at all times and with every breath.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Patanjali speaks of 14\nkinds of japa:&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; daily (nitya),\ncircumstantial (naimittika), the japa of desired results (kamya), forbidden\n(nishiddha), penitential (prayashchitta), unmoving (achala), moving (chala),\nvoiced (vachika), whispered (upanshu), murmured (bhramara), mental (manasa),\nuninterrupted (akhanda), nonuttered (ajapa) and circumambulatory (pradakshina).<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Quantum Physics tells\nus today that every state of matter has its own associated vibration.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">4000 years ago, Adi\nShankaracharya commented on the Brahma Sutras.&nbsp;\n\u201cThe sound created by the explosion of the primordial atom gave rise to\nthe causal, subtle and gross forms of the universe.\u201d<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Shabda-Brahman is a\nvibratory reality, which exists underlying the reality which we can perceive.\nAccording to Vedic theory, this pure vibrational current, flows eternally \u2013 a\nkind of river of sublime truths \u2013 that can be accessed by anyone who has the\nability to penetrate within it.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In case of each Tantric\nmantra, the practitioner needs to know its rishi (seer), devata (deific power),\nchanndas (rhythm), svara (accentuation), prayogya (application), beej (seed\npower), shakti (a fraction of itself that expresses its power), kavacha (armour),\nkilaka (recitation of which prevents the mantra\u2019s power from moving away from\nthe practitioner) and nyasa (the process by which various sounds in the mantra\nare identified with the energy in particular limbs).<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Nyasa involves touching\nvarious parts of the body while saying specific portions of a mantra. This\ninvokes the&nbsp; presence of the deity of the\nmantra inside the body. Each mantra is associated with a specific Nyasa. There\nare various types of Nyasas, the most important of them being Kara Nyasa and\nAnga Nyasa.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">No cosmic sound can be\nheard by man\u2019s naked ears.&nbsp; Scientists\nhave found that the sound emanating from planets is pitched twenty octaves\nbelow man\u2019s hearing, while the song of the atom is sung a complementary twenty octaves\nabove it, leaving us \u201cmusically midway\u201d between the trebles and basses of the\nmicro and macro-cosmic worlds.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The\nfunction of a mantra is to create vibrations in the inner consciousness, that\nwill prepare for realization.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Being indifferent\ntowards all objects, he who has controlled his passions should continuously\nconcentrate upon the sound which dissolves the mind.\u2026the sound proceeding from\nPranava (OM) which is BrahmAn itself-&nbsp;&nbsp;\n<b>Nadabindu Upanishad 5000 BC</b><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">OM is the quintessence,\nthe seed-syllable (bija mantra) of the universe, the universal force of the\nall-embracing consciousness.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The inner ear ( cochlea\n) gives the cycloid spiral space curve motion. It is the brain and central\nnervous system that hears.&nbsp; The inner ear\nis filled with liquid. Microscopic hairs called cilia project out into this\nliquid and they release a chemical neurotransmitter when stimulated. ( just\nlike the cats's whiskers ).<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Sound waves are\ntransformed into nerve impulses, to the temporal lobe of the cerebral cortex\nwhich is dedicated to sound.&nbsp; The audio\nrange is 20 hz to 20000 Hz.&nbsp; 1 hertz is\none cycle per second. All musicians convey the message in the 0.5- 4 KHz range\n.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A sound wave is a\nlongitudinal wave--a series of compressions and rarefactions.. Higher the\nfrequency, higher the perceived pitch.&nbsp; The\nwonder of the cilia hairs is that it can perceive 1500 levels of pitch.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u201cThat indestructible\ntranscendent vibrating sound is Shabda-Brahman.\u201d-- <b>Shiksha Upanishad 5000 BC</b><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Letters in Sanskrit are\ncalled akshara, the eternal; they are sound symbols of the eternal reality. The\nfunction of a mantra in Sanskrit is to create vibrations in the inner\nconsciousness. The Vedanta-sutras add that ultimate liberation comes from sound\n(anavrittih shabdat).&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\"The yoga which is\npracticed through the support of a proper mood (bhava) and sound (shabda), and\nthrough the support of the Self composed of name and form (nama-rupa) is called\nmantra-yoga.\"- Mantra-yoga-samhita (3.4)<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Mantra-yoga is one of\nthe most important paths within traditional yoga, and concerns the different\nexpressions of sound, from the most subtle to the coarsest. It is with good\nreason that the Vayaviya Samhita of the Shiva-purana, in describing the five\nclasses of yoga, places mantra yoga first.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Through sound we cease\nto return to a body, or we liberate ourselves.\" -- Vedanta-sutra&nbsp; (4.4.23)<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Conscious repetition of\nmantras liberates the energy that lies within them.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">6000 years ago\nKrishna&nbsp; says ( Bhagavad Gita) -&nbsp;&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>vedais ca sarvair aham\neva vedyam</i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\"The ultimate\npurpose of reading Vedas is to know Me.\"<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The four Vedas (Rig,\nYajur, Sama and Atharva) are not 'books' in the usual sense.&nbsp;&nbsp; They are comprised rather of tonally\naccented verses and hypnotic, abstruse melodies whose proper realizations\ndemand oral instead of visual transmission.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">They are robbed of their essence\nwhen transferred to paper, for without the human element the innumerable\nnuances and fine intonations \u2013 inseparable and necessary components of all four\ncompilations \u2013 are lost completely.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;The ultimate authority in Vedic matters is\nnever the printed page but rather the few members ... who are today\nkeeping&nbsp; 400 centuries old ORAL\ntraditions alive.</span></div>\n</div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot;, times, freeserif, serif;
