font-family: &quot;symbol&quot;; font-size: 10.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u00b7<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot;; font-size: 7pt; font-stretch: normal; line-height: normal;\">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;\n</span></span><!--[endif]--><span style=\"color: #222222; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Kakubh<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">For a given metre, (A)\nthe number of guru syllables, (B) the number of laghu syllables, (C) the total\nnumber of syllables, and (D) the total number of m\u0101tras, giving expressions for\neach of these in terms of any two of the other three. (The basic relations being\nthat C=A+B and D=2A+B.)<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">THE POWER OF VEDAS (\nSAMHITA ) &nbsp;IS IN THE SOUND.&nbsp; THE MEANING IS ONLY TO INSTILL A SENSE OF\nGRATITUDE.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The structure of meters\nin Sanskrit prosody include those based on fixed number of syllables per verse,\nand those based on fixed number of morae per verse<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A MATRA ( mora &nbsp;) is a unit in phonology that determines\nsyllable weight, which in some languages determines stress or timing.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">For example, the short\nvowel \"a\" ( AAH) is assigned a value of one m\u0101tr\u0101, the long vowel\n\"\u0101\" is assigned a value of two m\u0101tr\u0101s, and the compound vowel\n(diphthong) \"ai\" (which has either two simple short vowels,\n\"a\"+\"i\", or one long and one short vowel,\n\"\u0101\"+\"i\") is assigned a value of two m\u0101tr\u0101s.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Monomoraic syllables\nhave one mora, bimoraic syllables have two, and trimoraic syllables have three<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Sanskrit prosody and\nmetrics &nbsp;take into account moraic weight,\nas it were, rather than straight syllables, divided into \"laghu\" ( \"light\")\nand \"d\u012brgha\" / \"guru\" &nbsp;/ &nbsp;\"heavy\") feet based on how many\nmorae can be isolated in each word<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Gayatri meter was\nstructured with 3 verses of 8 syllables (6x4), the Usnih with 2 verses of 8 and\n1 of 12 syllables (7x4), the Anustubh with 4 verses of 8 syllables (8x4),\nBrihati with 2 verses of 8 followed by 1 each of 12 and 8 syllables (9x4), the\nPankti with 5 verses of 8 syllables (10x4), the Tristubh with 4 verses of 11\nsyllables (11x4), and the Jagati meter with 4 verses of 12 syllables each\n(12x4).<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;In Vedic culture, the Chandas were revered for\ntheir perfection and resonance, with Gayatri meter treated as the most refined\nand sacred, and one that continues to be part of modern Hindu culture as part\nof Yoga and hymns of meditation at sunrise<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The most exhaustive\ncompilations of Sanskrit prosody contain over 600 meters.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The hymns of Rigveda\ninclude the names of meters which, for the discipline of Chandas (Sanskrit\nprosody)<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Brahmanas layer (second\npart of Vedas ) of Vedic literature, contain a complete expression of the\nChandas<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Panini's treatise on\nSanskrit grammar distinguishes Chandas as verses that compose the Vedas, and\nBhasya to be the speech language used for learned discourse and scholastic\ndiscussion of the Vedas<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Vedic Sanskrit\ntexts employ fifteen meters, of which seven are common, and the most frequent\nare three (8-, 11- and 12-syllable lines).<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The post-Vedic texts,\nsuch as the epics as well as other classical literature of Hinduism, deploy\nboth linear and non-linear meters, many of which are based on syllables and\nothers based on diligently crafted verses based on repeating numbers of morae\n(matra per foot).. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">About 150 treatises on\nSanskrit prosody from classical era are known, in which some 850 meters were\ndefined and studied by the ancient and medieval Hindu scholars<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A syllable (Akshara),\nin Sanskrit prosody, is a vowel with one or more consonants, or a vowel without\nany. The short syllable is one with short (hrasva) vowels, which are a (</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u0905</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">),\ni (</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u0907</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">),\nu (</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u0909</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">),\n\u1e5b (</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u090b</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">)\nand \u1e37 (</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u090c</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">).\nThe long syllable is defined as one with long (dirgha) vowels, which are \u0101 (</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u0906</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">),\n\u012b (</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u0908</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">),\n\u016b (</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u090a</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">),\n\u1e5d (</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u0960</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">),\ne (</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u090f</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">),\nai (</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u0910</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">),\no (</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u0913</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">)\nand au (</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u0914</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">).<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A stanza (p\u0101da) is\ndefined in Sanskrit prosody as a group of four verses, also called as four\nquarters. Indian prosody studies developed two types of stanzas. Vritta stanza\nare those that are crafted with precise number syllables, while Jati stanza are\nthose that are designed based on syllabic instants (morae, matra).<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Vritta stanza are\nfurther recognized in three forms, with Samavritta where the four quarters are\nsimilar in its embedded mathematical pattern, Ardhasamavritta where alternate\nverses keep similar syllabic structure, and Vishamavritta where all four\nquarters are different. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A regular Vritta is\ndefined as that where the total number of syllables in each verse is less than\nor equal to 26 syllables, while irregulars contain more. &nbsp;When syllabic instants (matra) is the\nfoundation of the Sanskrit prosody, a short syllable is counted as one instant,\nand a long syllable is counted as two instants.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The metres found in\nclassical Sanskrit poetry are sometimes alternatively classified into three\nkinds.--<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Syllabic verse (\naksharavritta): meters depend on the number of syllables in a verse, with\nrelative freedom in the distribution of light and heavy syllables. This style\nis derived from older Vedic forms, and found in the great epics, the\nMahabharata and the Ramayana\u2026<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Syllabo-quantitative\nverse (var\u1e47av\u1e5btta or varnavritta): meters depend on syllable count, but the\nlight-heavy patterns are fixed.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Quantitative verse\n(m\u0101tr\u0101v\u1e5btta): meters depend on duration, where each verse-line has a fixed\nnumber of morae, usually grouped in sets of four.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In most of Sanskrit\npoetry the primary determinant of a meter is the number of syllables in a unit\nof verse, called the p\u0101da (\"foot\" or \"quarter\"). Meters of\nthe same length are distinguished by the pattern of laghu (\"light\")\nand guru (\"heavy\") syllables in the p\u0101da. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The rules\ndistinguishing laghu and guru syllables are the same as those for non-metric\nprose, and these are specified in Vedic Shiksha texts that study the principles\nand structure of sound, such as the Pratisakhyas. Some of the significant rules\nare:--<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A syllable is laghu\nonly if its vowel is hrasva (\"short\") and followed by at most one\nconsonant before another vowel is encountered.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A syllable with an\nanusvara ('\u1e43') or a visarga ('\u1e25') is always guru.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">All other syllables are\nguru, either because the vowel is d\u012brgha (\"long\"), or because the\nhrasva vowel is followed by a consonant cluster.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The hrasva vowels are\nthe short monophthongs: 'a', 'i', 'u', '\u1e5b' and '\u1e37'<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">All other vowels are\ndirgha: '\u0101', '\u012b', '\u016b', '\u1e5d', 'e', 'ai', 'o' and 'au'. (Note that,\nmorphologically, the last four vowels are actually the diphthongs 'ai', '\u0101i',\n'au' and '\u0101u', as the rules of sandhi in Sanskrit make clear.)<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Gangadasa Pandita\nstates that the last syllable in each p\u0101da may be considered guru, but a guru\nat the end of a p\u0101da is never counted as laghu.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">For measurement by\nm\u0101tr\u0101 (morae), laghu syllables count as one unit, and guru syllables as two\nunits.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Ga\u1e47a (Sanskrit,\n\"group\") is the technical term for the pattern of light and heavy\nsyllables in a sequence of three. It is used in treatises on Sanskrit prosody\nto describe meters<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Pingala's method\ndescribed any meter as a sequence of ga\u1e47as, or triplets of syllables\n(trisyllabic feet), plus the excess, if any, as single units. There being eight\npossible patterns of light and heavy syllables in a sequence of three, Pingala\nassociated a letter, allowing the meter to be described compactly as an acronym<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Pingala's order of the\nga\u1e47as, viz. m-y-r-s-t-j-bh-n, corresponds to a standard enumeration in binary,\nwhen the three syllables in each ga\u1e47a are read right-to-left with H=0 and L=1.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The sacred Gayatri\nmeter of the Hindus consists of three of iambic dimeter lines, and this\nembedded meter alone is at the heart of about 25% of the entire Rigveda<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Vedic Sanskrit\nprosody included both linear and non-linear systems. The field of Chandas was\norganized around seven major meters, &nbsp;called the \"seven birds\" or\n\"seven mouths of Brihaspati\", and each had its own rhythm, movements\nand aesthetics. The system mapped a non-linear structure (aperiodicity) into a\nfour verse polymorphic linear sequence.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u0917\u093e\u092f\u0924\u094d\u0930\u0947\u0923</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u092a\u094d\u0930\u0924\u093f</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u092e\u093f\u092e\u0940\u0924\u0947</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u0905\u0930\u094d\u0915\u092e\u0930\u094d\u0915\u0947\u0923</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u0938\u093e\u092e</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u0924\u094d\u0930\u0948\u0937\u094d\u091f\u0941\u092d\u0947\u0928</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u0935\u093e\u0915\u092e\u094d</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u0964</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u0935\u093e\u0915\u0947\u0928</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u0935\u093e\u0915\u0902</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u0926\u094d\u0935\u093f\u092a\u0926\u093e</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u091a\u0924\u0941\u0937\u094d\u092a\u0926\u093e\u0915\u094d\u0937\u0930\u0947\u0923</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u092e\u093f\u092e\u0924\u0947</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u0938\u092a\u094d\u0924</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u0935\u093e\u0923\u0940\u0903</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u0965\u0968\u096a\u0965</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">With the Gayatri, he\nmeasures a song; with the song \u2013 a chant, with the Tristubh \u2013 a recited stanza,<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">With the stanza of two\nfeet and four feet \u2013 a hymn; with the syllable they measure the seven voices. </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u0965</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">24</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u0965</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u2014\u2009<b>Rigveda 1.164.24, 5000 BC</b><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The seven major ancient\nSanskrit meters are the three 8-syllable Gayatri, the four 8-syllable Anustubh,\nthe four 11-syllable Tristubh, the four 12-syllable Jagati, and the mixed padas\nmeters named Ushnih, Brihati and Pankti.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Beyond these seven\nmeters, ancient &nbsp;Sanskrit scholars\ndeveloped numerous other syllable-based meters (Akshara-chandas). Examples\ninclude Atijagati (13x4, in 16 varieties), Sakkari (14x4, in 20 varieties),\nAtisakkari (15x4, in 18 varieties), Ashti (16x4, in 12 varieties), Atyashti\n(17x4, in 17 varieties), Dhriti (18x4, in 17 varieties), Atidhriti (19x4, in 13\nvarieties), Kriti (20x4, in 4 varieties) and so on<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Gana-chandas or\nGana-vritta, that is meters based on m\u0101tr\u0101s (morae, instants). The metric foot\nin these are designed from laghu (short) morae or their equivalents.&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Sixteen\nclasses of these instants-based meters are enumerated in Sanskrit prosody, each\nclass has sixteen sub-species. Examples include Arya, Udgiti, Upagiti, Giti and\nAryagiti.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This style of\ncomposition is less common than syllable-based metric texts, but found in\nimportant texts of Hindu philosophy, drama, lyrical works and Prakrit poetry.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The entire\nSamkhyakarika text of the Samkhya school of Hindu philosophy is composed in\nArya meter<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;Sanskrit hymns, used meters as tools of\nliterary architecture, wherein they coded a hymn's end by frequently using a\nverse of a meter different than that used in the hymn's body. However, they\nnever used Gayatri meter to end a hymn or composition, possibly because it\nenjoyed a special level of reverence in Hindu texts. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In general, all meters\nwere sacred and the Vedic chants and hymns attribute the perfection and beauty\nof the meters to divine origins, referring them as mythological characters or\nequivalent to gods.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; color: blue; font-size: large;\"><b><br /></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; color: blue; font-size: large;\"><b>Large and significant\nchanges in meter, wherein the meter of succeeding sections return to earlier\nsections, is an indication of POISON INJECTION </b></span><span style=\"font-size: 12pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<iframe allowfullscreen=\"\" class=\"YOUTUBE-iframe-video\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/BNHtyO7qwsk/0.jpg\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/BNHtyO7qwsk?feature=player_embedded\" width=\"320\"></iframe></div>\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Anushtubh Vedic\nmeter has been the most popular in classical and post-classical Sanskrit works It\nis also octosyllabic, next harmonic to Gayatri meter that is sacred to the\nHindus, and it appears either in free verse or fixed syllabic form (shloka). <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">It has a rhythm, offers\nflexibility and creative space, but has embedded rules such as its sixth\nsyllable is always long, the fifth syllable is always short; often, the seventh\nsyllable in even numbered lines of a stanza is short (iambic) as well. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Anushtubh is\npresent in Vedic texts, but its presence is minor, and Trishtubh and Gayatri\nmeters dominate in the Rigveda for example. A dominating presence of the\nAnushtubh meter in a text is a marker that the text is likely post-Vedic.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Mahabharata, for\nexample, features many verse meters in its chapters, but an overwhelming\nproportion of the stanzas, 95% are shlokas of the anustubh type, and most of\nthe rest are tristubhs.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Hindu epics and the\npost-Vedic classical Sanskrit poetry is typically structured as quatrains of\nfour p\u0101das (verses), with the metrical structure of each p\u0101da completely\nspecified. In some cases, pairs of p\u0101das may be scanned together as the\nhemistichs of a couplet. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">It is then normal for\nthe p\u0101das comprising a pair to have different structures, to complement each\nother aesthetically. Otherwise the four p\u0101das of a stanza have the same\nstructure.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Chandas have been\nrevered in Hindu texts for their perfection and resonance, with Gayatri meter\ntreated as the most refined and sacred, and one that continues to be part of\nmodern Hindu culture as part of Yoga and hymns of SURYANAMASKAR<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<iframe allowfullscreen=\"\" class=\"YOUTUBE-iframe-video\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/hjduAAvCD8E/0.jpg\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/hjduAAvCD8E?feature=player_embedded\" width=\"320\"></iframe></div>\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></span>\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\">The\nVedic texts ( sruti ) were orally transmitted, for 330 centuries without the\nuse of script, ( before being penned down 70 centuries ago )&nbsp; &nbsp;in an\nunbroken line of transmission from teacher to student that was formalized early\non. <o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\">THIS\nIS THE GREATEST FEAT EVER BY MAN .<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%; mso-bidi-font-family: Calibri; mso-bidi-theme-font: minor-latin;\"><span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\">This\nensured an impeccable textual transmission superior to the classical texts of\nother cultures; it is, in fact, something like a tape-recording.... Not just\nthe actual words, but even the long-lost musical (tonal) accent has been\npreserved up to the present.</span></span><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<span style=\"background-color: white;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<iframe allowfullscreen=\"\" class=\"YOUTUBE-iframe-video\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/AMQS03VNU-w/0.jpg\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/AMQS03VNU-w?feature=player_embedded\" width=\"320\"></iframe></div>\n<span style=\"background-color: white;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"background-color: white;\"><span style=\"color: red;\"><b>BELOW : KANCHA ILAIH NAY SHEPHARD CRIED -- &nbsp;WE DALITS ALSO WANT TO CHANT!</b></span></span><br />\n<span style=\"background-color: white;\"><span style=\"color: red;\"><b><br /></b></span></span>\n<span style=\"background-color: white;\"><span style=\"color: red;\"><b>CAN HE DO THIS FOR A LIFETIME- &nbsp;LIKE STUDYING FOR EXAMS FOREVER ?</b></span></span><br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<iframe allowfullscreen=\"\" class=\"YOUTUBE-iframe-video\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/zl7E00fIHbM/0.jpg\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/zl7E00fIHbM?feature=player_embedded\" width=\"320\"></iframe></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"avatar-image-container\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; float: left; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 16px; margin: 0.2em 0px 0px; max-height: 36px; overflow: hidden; width: 36px;\">\n<img kasperskylab_antibanner=\"on\" src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-57G2xiZ-5tM/WJwrrVpmOmI/AAAAAAABQqo/-9wsspdm4RAiWSVRYXpBpkgoVBQdEyLRQCK4B/s35/*\" style=\"border: 1px solid rgb(238, 238, 238); text-decoration-line: none;\">April 14, 2017 at 1:35 PM</a></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-content\" id=\"bc_0_8MC\" style=\"margin-bottom: 8px; text-align: justify;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">THE MORALE OF OUR ARMED FORCES IN NOW AT ITS LOWEST EBB</span><br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">THANKS TO DESH DROHIS FROM WITHIN</span><br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">WE KNOW THE POLITICIANS&nbsp;</span><br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">WE KNOW THE BENAMI MEDIA BARONS</span><br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">WE KNOW THE COLLEGIUM JUDGES</span><br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">WE KNOW THE MEMBERS OF NCM</span><br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">WE KNOW THE MEMBERS OF NHRC</span><br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">WE KNOW THE FOREIGN FUNDED NGOs&nbsp;</span><br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">WHO SIDE WITH KASHMIRI STONE PELTERS, SEPARATISTS , JNU COMMIE PROFESSORS, NAXALS&nbsp;</span><br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">WE HAVE SHEEP LEADING OUR ARMY OF LIONS</span></div>\n<div style=\"text-align: left;\">\n<b style=\"font-size: x-large;\"><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\">COURT MARTIAL THE TOP ARMY COMMANDERS IN KASHMIR WHO HAVE CRUSHED THE MORALE OF OUR ARMY</span></span></b></div>\n<span style=\"color: blue; font-size: large;\"></span><br />\n<div style=\"text-align: left;\">\n<span style=\"color: blue; font-size: large;\"><span style=\"font-weight: bold;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<span style=\"color: blue; font-size: large;\">\n<b></b></span>\n<br />\n<div style=\"text-align: left;\">\n<span style=\"color: blue; font-size: large;\"><b><b><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 24px;\">AT FREQUENT INTERVALS HE WOULD CRAVE THE INDULGENCE OF MY SON\u2014IMPLORING \"SIR, AM I RIGHT\"<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 24px;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 24px;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 24px;\">MY SON WAS SO EMBARRASSED -- THE KOREAN DID THE WHOLE PROJECT IN ONE FLOWING SHOT -- LITERALLY THANKFUL WHEN MY SON SAID-- \" YES , CONTINUE\" TO HIS \" SIR- AM I RIGHT SO FAR ? \"<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 24px;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 24px;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 24px;\">WHEN THE CODE WAS WRITTEN AND TESTED -- MY ELDER SON TOLD HIM&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;\"SO FAR YOU HAVE DONE EVERYTHING&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;-- I WILL WRITE THE FINAL PROJECT REPORT \"<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 24px;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 24px;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 24px;\">MY SON WAS A SLEEPING PARTNER IN THIS PROJECT. HE WAS HONEST TO ADMIT IT .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 24px;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 24px;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 24px;\">MY SON INSISTED AND WROTE THE KOREAN BOYs NAME FIRST FOLLOWED BY HIS NAME-- THROUGH COLLEGE RULES REQUIRED THE MASTERs STUDENTS NAME FIRST AND THEN THE UNDERGRADUATE STUDENTs NAME<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 24px;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 24px;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 24px;\">JEW ALBERT EINSTEIN WAS A MEDIOCRE BRAIN\u2014HE WAS ABSOLUTE DISGRACE IN MATH\u2014EINSTEIN DID NOT HAVE A MATHEMATICAL BRAIN-- HE OUTSOURCED ALL HIS MATH..<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 24px;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 24px;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 24px;\">ALL HIS AWARD WINNING IDEAS OF EINSTEIN IS STOLEN FROM FROM VEDAS AND SECONDARY ONES -- STOLEN FROM AN INTELLECTUAL PATENT POOL OF WHICH HE WAS CLEVERLY PLACED AS THE GUARDIAN CLERK BY JEW ROTHSCHILD<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 24px;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 24px;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 24px;\">SRINIVASAN RAMANUJAN THE INDIAN MATH GENIUS --LOST HIS DIARY, IN WHICH HE HAD RECORDED ALL HIS PRICELESS FINDINGS . THE JEW BASTARDS STOLE IT. AFTER THAT RAMANUJAN USED TO DO HIS WORK ON A SLATE , RUB IT OFF AND RETAIN RESULTS INSIDE HIS HEAD<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 24px;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 24px;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 24px;\">SRINIVASAN RAMANUJAN WAS POISONED \u2013<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 24px;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 24px;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 24px;\">HIS YOUNG WIFE STARTED CRYING BITTERLY ( SHE WAS NOT THE CRYING TYPE ) AS SOON AS THE PYRE WAS LIT AND FEL INTO A FAINT -- WHEN WELL WISHERS PRESSED HER, SHE REVEALED THE TRUTH ABOUT THE \"LOST DIARY\"..<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 24px;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 24px;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; You have known neither paradise nor hell. Here there is no happiness, no punishment, no family, no enemies. Rise in tranquility. Here words end, like thought. This was your last illusion- the veil of MAYA is now lifted .\u201d<br />\n<br />\nTHE SHALLOW MIND OF THE WHITE MAN CANNOT UNDERSTAND WHAT I WROTE ABOVE<br />\n<br />\nThe philosophy of ancient India is quite diverse and complex in structure. So complex, in fact, that almost all have given up on making sense of this kaleidoscope\u2014till Quantum physics came on the scene.<br />\n<br />\nYet since the advent of quantum physics reveals that Vedanta is beyond the cutting edge of physics, which is only now, discovering the illusory nature of physical reality and the existence of subtler energy and information currents behind all that we see.<br />\n<br />\nVedanta is the very science of consciousness at both human and cosmic levels. It recognises consciousness as the ultimate reality and affirms its presence in all existence.<br />\n<br />\nModern physicists have looked to Vedanta for understanding their proposed unitary field of consciousness behind the universe, to explain the coherence of all cosmic laws and understand the THEORY OF EVERYTHING represented by the divine geometry of Sri Yantra ( the geometry of OM)<br />\n<br />\nVedanta is the unitary philosophy explaining the oneness of the individual soul with the universal consciousness.<br />\n<br />\nSuperluminal communication is a hypothetical process in which information is sent at faster-than-light (FTL) speeds. If wormholes are possible, then ordinary subluminal methods of communication could be sent through them to achieve superluminal transmission speeds<br />\n<br />\nOn the surface Quantum Physics (QP) and Vedanta may look very different. One is part of the scientific tradition and the other in some ways is philosophy soaked in spirituality.<br />\n<br />\nScience is trying to understand the universe \u2018out there\u2019 and Vedanta addressed the universe \u2018inside you\u2019\u201d<br />\n<br />\nOne of the fundamental difference between western philosophy, with that,of Vedanta is that ,the western philosophy believe the universe and everything in the universe belongs to god.<br />\n<br />\nOn the other hand Vedanta philosophy believe that god himself present in each and every atom of this creation ,god is present not only in human, but even in animals ,plants , rocks ,stars planets atom and molecules.<br />\n<br />\nTo a Vedantic every part of this universe is dynamic, it is vibrating, it is listening and can respond according to ones KARMA, It can be by action and can be purely thought. The universe listens to our action as well as thought and gives in return what exactly we want either knowingly or unknowingly, weather it is bad or good.<br />\n<br />\nThe scientific tradition is about Science of object. And Vedanta is called science of consciousness or science of subject. And is not a philosophy<br />\n<br />\n<br />\nCONTINUED TO 2-</div>\n</div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 24px;\"><span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\"></span></span><br />\n<div class=\"comment-replies\" id=\"bc_0_9BR\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; padding: 16px 0px 8px;\"><div class=\"avatar-image-container\" style=\"float: left; margin: 0.2em 0px 0px; max-height: 36px; overflow: hidden; width: 36px;\">\n</div>\n<div class=\"comment-block\" id=\"c7603640773661651980\" style=\"margin-left: 48px; position: relative;\">\n<div class=\"comment-header\" id=\"bc_0_6M\" kind=\"m\" style=\"margin: 0px 0px 8px;\">\n<cite class=\"user blog-author\" style=\"font-style: normal; font-weight: bold;\"><a href=\"https://www.blogger.com/profile/14410812789424637654\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888;\">Capt. Ajit Vadakayil</a></cite><span class=\"icon user blog-author\" style=\"background-image: url(&quot;data:image/png; background-repeat: no-repeat; display: inline-block; font-weight: bold; height: 18px; margin: 0px 0px -4px 6px; width: 18px;\"></span><span class=\"datetime secondary-text\" style=\"margin-left: 6px;\"><a href=\"https://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2017/12/comments-overflow-for-inoperative-load_30.html?showComment=1514595060183#c7603640773661651980\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888;\">December 30, 2017 at 6:21 AM</a></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-content\" id=\"bc_0_6MC\" style=\"margin-bottom: 8px; text-align: justify;\">\nCONTINUED FROM 1-<br />\n<br />\n<br />\nMundaka Upanishad says: \u201cJust as a spider projects its own web and then re-absorbs it into its own body, so also That One Reality projects this variegated universe and then absorbs it back into it.\u201d<br />\n<br />\nSanatana Dharma views the universe as an inseparable web, whose interconnections are dynamic and not static, the cosmic web is alive; it moves and grows and changes continually.<br />\n<br />\nModern physics, too, has come to conceive of the universe as such a web of relations and, like Vedanta, has recognized that this web is intrinsically dynamic. The dynamic aspect of matter arises in quantum theory as a consequence of the wave-nature of subatomic particles.<br />\n<br />\nTalking about the Quantum Physics we stumbled upon the most bizarre result of quantum theory came when Bell\u2019s theorem and subsequent experiments proved the so called entanglements to be right. In such cases, two or more atoms, electrons or photons demonstrate correlated properties even at distances where no communication is possible between them during the given time.<br />\n<br />\nThese developments are the most important developments in the history of physics and perhaps in the whole of science. They give rise to the idea of the interconnected wholeness of the world and non-local interactions in contrast to the separate identities with local interactions.<br />\n<br />\nThe Kerala school of math used math as a spiritual activity \u2013based on which astrology thrived. They used math as a most subtle and rigorous form of thought.<br />\n<br />\nBoth Pythagoras and Plato studied in the Kerala school of Math at Kodungallur university and they introduced this concept to the west without really understanding the depth<br />\n<br />\nEven today, the modern mind has NOT reached the bottom of the ancient Indian sage\u2019s mind.<br />\n<br />\nThe white historian must know that ENTIRE Greek philosophy was stolen from Indian philosophy written 4500 years earlier.<br />\n<br />\nGreeks never really understood the real essence of profound subjects like Epistemology, though Indian sages taught them in their own lands. Pythagoras ( died 495 BC ) and Plato studied in India. Aristotle lifted from Vedanta material taken out of India<br />\n<br />\nPlato ( died 348 BC ) , a homosexual shared his stolen from Kodungallur University spoils with his mentor Socrates ( died 399 BC ) , and fellow homosexual side kick Aristotle ( died 322 BC ) and got himself immortalized as the founder of the Academy in Athens, the first institution of higher learning in the Western world.<br />\n<br />\nAristotle, Socrates and Plato were hardcore homosexuals . Aristotle initiated Alexander the great into homosexuality.<br />\n<br />\nQuantum Teleportation ( mentioned in Vedas ) has been achieved. Scientists from China recently set the record for the farthest quantum teleportation ever, when they beamed a photon in its quantum state into orbit. This brings several quantum mechanical concepts into the equation, including quantum entanglement.<br />\n<br />\nTeleportation is a verification of Quantum Entanglement<br />\n<br />\nAction at a distance implies that a physical object can be moved by non-physical means, so not by touch or physical force. With entanglement, it means that either information is travelling FAR FAR faster than the speed of light ( VEDAS SAYS IT IS INSTANTANEOUS )<br />\n<br />\nWorldview paradigms are changing, yet old scientific dogma ( THANKS TO THE CUNT POPE ) still sticks around and dominates.<br />\n<br />\nQuantum entanglement\u2014 physics at its strangest \u2014 ( written down in Vedas 7000 years ago ) has moved out of this world and into space.<br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"color: red;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2011/01/quantum-entanglement-video-capt-ajit.html</span><br />\n<br />\nA team of Chinese physicists sent eerily intertwined quantum particles from a satellite to ground stations separated by 1200 kilometers, smashing the previous world record.<br />\n<br />\nThe result is a stepping stone to ultrasecure communication networks and, eventually, a space-based quantum internet.<br />\n<br />\n<br />\nCONTINUED TO 3-</div>\n<span class=\"comment-actions secondary-text\" id=\"bc_0_6MN\" kind=\"m\"><span class=\"item-control blog-admin pid-1783552029\" style=\"display: inline;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-replies\" id=\"bc_0_6BR\" style=\"margin-left: 36px; margin-top: 1em;\">\n</div>\n<div class=\"comment-replybox-single\" id=\"bc_0_6B_box\" style=\"margin-left: 48px; margin-top: 5px;\">\n</div>\n</li>\n<li class=\"comment\" id=\"bc_0_7B\" kind=\"b\" style=\"margin: 0px 0px 16px; padding: 0.25em 0px 8px;\"><div class=\"avatar-image-container\" style=\"float: left; margin: 0.2em 0px 0px; max-height: 36px; overflow: hidden; width: 36px;\">\n</div>\n<div class=\"comment-block\" id=\"c2849351715198825203\" style=\"margin-left: 48px; position: relative;\">\n<div class=\"comment-header\" id=\"bc_0_7M\" kind=\"m\" style=\"margin: 0px 0px 8px;\">\n<cite class=\"user blog-author\" style=\"font-style: normal; font-weight: bold;\"><a href=\"https://www.blogger.com/profile/14410812789424637654\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888;\">Capt. Ajit Vadakayil</a></cite><span class=\"icon user blog-author\" style=\"background-image: url(&quot;data:image/png; background-repeat: no-repeat; display: inline-block; font-weight: bold; height: 18px; margin: 0px 0px -4px 6px; width: 18px;\"></span><span class=\"datetime secondary-text\" style=\"margin-left: 6px;\"><a href=\"https://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2017/12/comments-overflow-for-inoperative-load_30.html?showComment=1514595161341#c2849351715198825203\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888;\">December 30, 2017 at 6:22 AM</a></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-content\" id=\"bc_0_7MC\" style=\"margin-bottom: 8px; text-align: justify;\">\nCONTINUED FROM 2-<br />\n<br />\nEntanglement involves putting objects in the peculiar limbo of quantum superposition, in which an object's quantum properties occupy multiple states at once<br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"color: red;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2011/02/schrodinger-father-of-quantum-physics.html</span><br />\n<br />\nPhysicists have entangled particles such as electrons and photons, as well as larger objects such as superconducting electric circuits.<br />\n<br />\nTheoretically, even if entangled objects are separated, their precarious quantum states should remain linked until one of them is measured or disturbed. That measurement instantly determines the state of the other object, no matter how far away. The idea is so counterintuitive that IDIOT Albert Einstein mocked it as \"spooky action at a distance.\"<br />\n<br />\nIn 2015, the most sophisticated of these tests, which involved measuring entangled electrons 1.3 kilometers apart, showed once again that spooky action is real.<br />\n<br />\nBeyond the fundamental result, such experiments also point to the possibility of hack-proof communications.<br />\n<br />\nLong strings of entangled photons, shared between distant locations, can be \"quantum keys\" that secure communications. Anyone trying to eavesdrop on a quantum-encrypted message would disrupt the shared key, alerting everyone to a compromised channel.<br />\n<br />\nPSSSSTTT-- BEFORE CHINA INVENTS THE QUANTUM SATELLITE--WE MUST BREAK THE NATION INTO 4 PARTS AND HAVE TIBET AS A NEIGHBOUR<br />\n<br />\n<br />\nEntangled photons degrade rapidly as they pass through the air or optical fibers. So far, the farthest anyone has sent a quantum key is a few hundred kilometers.<br />\n<br />\nOnce you have satellites distributing your quantum signals throughout the globe, you've done it,--You've leapfrogged all the problems you have with losses in fibers.<br />\n<br />\nJian-Wei Pan, a physicist at the University of Science and Technology of China in Shanghai, got the chance to test the idea when the Micius satellite, was launched in August 2016. The satellite is the foundation of the $100 million Quantum Experiments at Space Scale program<br />\n<br />\nBell's theorem is a \"no-go theorem\" that draws an important distinction between quantum mechanics (QM) and the world as described by classical mechanics<br />\n<br />\nIn its simplest form, Bell's theorem states: No physical theory of local hidden variables can ever reproduce all of the predictions of quantum mechanics.<br />\n<br />\nBell's theorem is the most profound discovery of science.and it is lifted straight out of the Vedas<br />\n<br />\nThere is no need for a faster-than-light signal to tell particle A what measurement has been carried out on particle B, because the universe, including particle A, already 'knows' what that measurement, and its outcome, will be.<br />\n<br />\nLOT OF MY DETRACTORS WERE GUFFAWING LIKE DONKEY WHO HAVE SEEN FRESH SHIT WHEN THEY HEARD THAT MY WIFE MATCHED MORE THAN 500 HOROSCOPES FOR MY ELDER SONs BRIDE<br />\n<br />\nBell\u2019s theorem and subsequent experiments proved the so called entanglements to be right. In such cases, two or more atoms, electrons or photons demonstrate correlated properties even at distances where no communication is possible between them during the given time.<br />\n<br />\nThese developments are the most important developments in the history of physics and the whole of science. They agree with Vedanta. They give rise to the idea of the interconnected wholeness of the world and non-local interactions in contrast to the separate identities with local interactions.<br />\n<br />\nIn their first experiment, the Chinese team sent a laser beam into a light-altering crystal on the satellite. The crystal emitted pairs of photons entangled so that their polarization states would be opposite when one was measured.<br />\n<br />\nThe pairs were split, with photons sent to separate receiving stations in Delingha and Lijiang, 1200 kilometers apart. Both stations are in the mountains of Tibet, reducing the amount of air the fragile photons had to traverse., the team reports simultaneously measuring more than 1000 photon pairs.<br />\n<br />\n<br />\nCONTINUED TO 4--</div>\n<span class=\"comment-actions secondary-text\" id=\"bc_0_7MN\" kind=\"m\"><span class=\"item-control blog-admin pid-1783552029\" style=\"display: inline;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-replies\" id=\"bc_0_7BR\" style=\"margin-left: 36px; margin-top: 1em;\">\n</div>\n<div class=\"comment-replybox-single\" id=\"bc_0_7B_box\" style=\"margin-left: 48px; margin-top: 5px;\">\n</div>\n</li>\n<li class=\"comment\" id=\"bc_0_8B\" kind=\"b\" style=\"border-bottom: 0px; margin: 0px 0px 16px; padding: 0.25em 0px 0px;\"><div class=\"avatar-image-container\" style=\"float: left; margin: 0.2em 0px 0px; max-height: 36px; overflow: hidden; width: 36px;\">\n</div>\n<div class=\"comment-block\" id=\"c5265314992318285551\" style=\"margin-left: 48px; position: relative;\">\n<div class=\"comment-header\" id=\"bc_0_8M\" kind=\"m\" style=\"margin: 0px 0px 8px;\">\n<cite class=\"user blog-author\" style=\"font-style: normal; font-weight: bold;\"><a href=\"https://www.blogger.com/profile/14410812789424637654\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888;\">Capt. Ajit Vadakayil</a></cite><span class=\"icon user blog-author\" style=\"background-image: url(&quot;data:image/png; background-repeat: no-repeat; display: inline-block; font-weight: bold; height: 18px; margin: 0px 0px -4px 6px; width: 18px;\"></span><span class=\"datetime secondary-text\" style=\"margin-left: 6px;\"><a href=\"https://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2017/12/comments-overflow-for-inoperative-load_30.html?showComment=1514595226017#c5265314992318285551\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888;\">December 30, 2017 at 6:23 AM</a></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-content\" id=\"bc_0_8MC\" style=\"margin-bottom: 8px; text-align: justify;\">\nCONTINUED FROM 3-<br />\n<br />\nThey found the photons had opposite polarizations far more often than would be expected by chance, thus confirming spooky action over a record distance<br />\n<br />\nThe team had to overcome many hurdles, including keeping the beams of photons focused on the ground stations as the satellite hurtled through space at nearly 8 kilometers per second.<br />\n<br />\nPan baby's team recovered only about one photon out of every 6 million sent from the satellite\u2014far better than ground-based experiments but still far too few for practical quantum communication.<br />\n<br />\nPan expects China's National Space Science Center to launch additional satellites with stronger and cleaner beams that could be detected even when the sun is shining. (Micius operates only at night.)<br />\n<br />\nIn the next 5 years we plan to launch some really practical quantum satellites, Pan baby says \u2013and I believe him<br />\n<br />\nIn the meantime, Pan baby plans to use Micius to distribute quantum keys to Chinese ground stations, which will require longer strings of photons and additional steps.<br />\n<br />\nThen he wants to demonstrate intercontinental quantum key distribution between stations in China and Austria, which will require holding one half of an entangled photon pair on board until the Austrian ground station appears within view of the satellite.<br />\nPan baby also plans to teleport a quantum state\u2014a technique for transferring quantum-encoded information without moving an actual object\u2014from a third Tibetan observatory to the satellite.<br />\n<br />\nMY ELDER SONs CODING PARTNER IS A CHINK--HE SAYS IS VERY INTELLIGENT<br />\n<br />\nEuropean and U.S. teams are also proposing putting quantum instruments on the International Space Station. One goal is to test whether entanglement is affected by a changing gravitational field, by comparing a photon that stays in the weaker gravitational environment of orbit with an entangled partner sent to Earth.<br />\n<br />\nThere are not many experiments which test links between gravity and quantum physics.<br />\n<br />\nThe implications go beyond record-setting demonstrations: A network of satellites will soon connect the quantum computers being designed in labs worldwide.<br />\n<br />\nAgain --quantum entanglement, one of the odder aspects of quantum theory, links the properties of particles even when they are separated by large distances. When a property of one of a pair of entangled particles is measured, the other \"immediately\" settles down into a state compatible with that measurement.<br />\n<br />\nSo how fast is \"immediately\"?<br />\n<br />\nAccording to research by Prof. Juan Yin and colleagues at the University of Science and Technology of China in Shanghai, the lower limit to the speed associated with entanglement dynamics \u2013 or \"spooky action at a distance\" \u2013 is at least 10,000 times faster than light.<br />\n<br />\nVedas says INSTANTANEOUSLY<br />\n<br />\nNiels Bohr, one of the prime developers of quantum theory, once said that those who are not shocked when they first encounter quantum theory cannot possibly have understood it. Eighty years later, this is still true, and applies even to those of us who first encountered quantum theory decades ago.<br />\n<br />\nVEDAS SAYS THAT DARK MATTER ( KALI ) HAS SPEED TOO.<br />\n<br />\nDark matter is a constant sea of matter traveling the opposite direction in the timeline, only appearing for a moment, travelling beyond light-speed, exerting gravity.<br />\n<br />\nGravity is the result of an amount of matter pulling itself together, to create compressive force toward the center, which curves all energy paths both directions in the 4th dimension The closer to center-of-gravity, the faster energy moves, hence the inward pull of gravity. The gravity \u201cfield\u201d is the area where spacetime tries to even itself out.<br />\n<br />\nLIGHT FROM QUASARS ( SARASWATI ) IS FASTER THAN LIGHT .<br />\n<br />\nCUNT Isaac Newtons \"isolated systems \" are NOT found in nature. He did NOT understand what he presented to the world as 99% of his work , including calculus was stolen from 6000 year old Vedic era books.<br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"color: red;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2011/01/isaac-newton-calculus-thief-capt-ajit.html</span><br />\n<br />\nCapt ajit vadakayil<br />\n..</div>\n</div>\n</li>\n</span></ol>\n<span id=\"bc_0_9b+seedEdduD\" kind=\"d\">\n</span></div>\n</div>\n</div>\n<span style=\"color: red; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b><br /></b></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"avatar-image-container\" style=\"background-color: #eeeeee; float: left; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 16px; margin: 0.2em 0px 0px; max-height: 36px; overflow: hidden; width: 36px;\">\n<img src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-57G2xiZ-5tM/WJwrrVpmOmI/AAAAAAABQqo/-9wsspdm4RAiWSVRYXpBpkgoVBQdEyLRQCK4B/s35/*\" style=\"border: 1px solid rgb(238, 238, 238); max-width: 36px;\" /></div>\n<span style=\"color: red; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"></span><br />\n<div class=\"comment-block\" id=\"c8429058010215276217\" style=\"background-color: #eeeeee; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 16px; margin-left: 48px; position: relative;\">\n<div class=\"comment-header\" id=\"bc_0_124M\" kind=\"m\" style=\"margin: 0px 0px 8px;\">\n<cite class=\"user blog-author\" style=\"font-style: normal; font-weight: bold;\"><a href=\"https://www.blogger.com/profile/14410812789424637654\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration-line: none;\">Capt. font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Left handed disgraced Kerala Namboodiris ( homosexuals\nsegregated in Minicoy )&nbsp; created Judaism\nand Hebrew language.&nbsp; This is why Hebrew\nwas written from right to left.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This is the reason why\nin ancient days whenever the Jews in Palestine were persecuted they fled to\nKerala (home) &nbsp;half way across the globe\n. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">This was written in Sanskrit and Malayalam at\nleast 5000 years before it was written in any other language.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Mind you ,all these fancy English ( Greeko )\nnames are all STOLEN from the ancient Hindu calendar.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">All their constellations names too are\nstolen. &nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\"><b>The names are originally in\nMalayalam and Sanskrit . &nbsp;&nbsp;</b></span><br />\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\"><b><br /></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\"><b>Just a few examples:<o:p></o:p></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\"><b>Tulam is Libra ( balance ).<o:p></o:p></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\"><b>Chingam or Simham is Leo ( lion )<o:p></o:p></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\"><b>Kanni or kanya is Virgo ( virgin girl )<o:p></o:p></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\"><b>Meenam is Pisces ( fish )<o:p></o:p></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\"><b>Kumbam is Aquarius ( water pot ).<o:p></o:p></b></span></div>\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\"><b>\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n</b></span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><span style=\"background-color: yellow;\"><b>Midhunam is Gemini ( couple )</b></span><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Namboodiris\nwere pure Sanskrit speaking parts of Thiyyas &nbsp;( ancient &nbsp;ruling &nbsp;class of Kerala ) who excelled in Math and\nAstronomy .&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">The creamy layer of Namboodiris were called ARYAN.&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;Aryabhatta\nthe great Mathematician ( Aryan Bhattathiripad -2700 BC ) was NOT a white skinned blonde\nman who came from Germany.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">&nbsp;On the\ncontrary a disgraced Namboodiri homosexual (<span style=\"background-color: white;\"> inbreeding\u2014 left hander who ate\nhis twin inside the womb --yes --be shocked !&nbsp;</span>) created\nJudaism .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; text-decoration-line: none;\">April 14, 2017 at 1:51 PM</a></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-content\" id=\"bc_0_0MC\" style=\"margin-bottom: 8px; text-align: justify;\">\nWHEN YOU BURY A DEAD BODY--THE SOUL WHICH ESCAPED FROM CADAVER REMAINS TRAPPED ON EARTH FOREVER --LOST AND MISERABLE</div>\n<div style=\"text-align: left;\">\n<b><span style=\"color: purple;\">WHEN YOU CREMATE A DEAD BODY , THE SOUL AWAITS AT THE CREMATION GROUNDS TILL THE SKULL POPS</span></b></div>\n<br />\n<div style=\"text-align: left;\">\n<b><span style=\"color: blue;\">THIS POPPING OF SKULL ( LIKE BREAKING A COCONUT ) CREATES A SOLITON ( TSUNAMI ) WAVE --THE CARRIER WAVE WHICH TRANSPORTS THE SOUL TO ITS SUITABLE ASTRAL LEVEL FROM ONE TO SEVEN</span></b></div>\n<br />\nASTRAL LAYER SEVEN IS VAIKUNTA-- ONLY MOKSHA SOULS CAN REACH THERE --<br />\n<br />\nONCE A SOUL REACHES ASTRAL LAYER SEVEN IT MERGES WITH THE MOTHER FIELD OF BRAHMAN ( MORPHOGENETIC CONSCIOUSNESS FIELD ) NEVER TO BE RE INDUCTED BACK ON PLANET EARTH AGAIN.<br />\n<br />\nTHIS SOUL HAS EVOLVED FROM UNICELLED FUNGI TO BACTERIA TO GRASS TO BANYAN TREE TO GROSS ANIMAL TO CONSCIOUS ANIMAL TO CONSCIOUS MAN<br />\n<br />\nTHIS SOUL WAS ONCE PART OF BRAHMAN -- BRAHMAN SHEARED OFF PART OF HIS OWN BODY REDUCED THE FREQUENCY AND SET IT TO EARTH--TO EVOLVE , INCREASE ITS FREQUENCY TO HIGHEST AGAIN -- AND MERGE WITH THE MOTHER FIELD<br />\n<br />\nIT IS A CLOSED FEEDBACK LOOP<br />\n<br />\nBRAHMAN KNOWS EVERYTHING<br />\n<br />\nWHEN THE FEED BACK BECOMES STAGNANT--PRALAYA WILL HAPPEN ( DISSOLUTION OF COSMOS )<br />\n<br />\nCHANGE IS THE ONLY CONSTANT--AS TOLD IN BHAGAWAD GITA<br />\n<br />\n<b><span style=\"color: red;\">IF THE SKULL OF THE FATHER DOES NOT POP THE ELDEST SON BREAKS THE SKULL WITH A BAMBOO POLE BEFORE THE EMBERS DIE DOWN.</span></b><br />\nTHE WORLD IS COMING BACK TO CREMATION<br />\n<br />\nSINCE BURIAL RELIGIONS CAME INTO EXISTENCE , THIS PLANET HAS KNOWN NO PEACE<br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"color: style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The cosmic blue print\nof the Christian bible was written in Kodungallur University owned by the\nCalicut King \u2013 my hometown.&nbsp; &nbsp;Those days only Kerala astrologers understood\nastrology , leave alone precession . &nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; ,
