font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\">I WILL SET AN OBJECTIVE EXAM FOR YOU\u2014 200 ITEM<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-vdeLu0FZAtU/WO99Nh1KC0I/AAAAAAABSdY/4ycEPEjfQHY6lcb9_9_DFjKGtgQiAA0xwCEw/s1600/bru_c4h26_f016.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"438\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-vdeLu0FZAtU/WO99Nh1KC0I/AAAAAAABSdY/4ycEPEjfQHY6lcb9_9_DFjKGtgQiAA0xwCEw/s640/bru_c4h26_f016.png\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n</div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><span style=\"background-color: cyan;\">IF ANYBODY CAN SCORE &nbsp;MORE THAN 10%-- &nbsp; I WILL STOP\nWRITING</span><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n</div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n</div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-cPtkRbPbAQ0/WO99UnFHvmI/AAAAAAABSdc/RNImJPuLObw6yFqo0n-EiXCu-ZeWAfV3ACEw/s1600/B97814160366160D00018_f001-002-9781416036616.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"552\" src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-cPtkRbPbAQ0/WO99UnFHvmI/AAAAAAABSdc/RNImJPuLObw6yFqo0n-EiXCu-ZeWAfV3ACEw/s640/B97814160366160D00018_f001-002-9781416036616.jpg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-oiWocZdKyJk/WO9-WmhjkHI/AAAAAAABSds/Q3ENFjw7iAwccwCDl1K0Ntp9--qIJ-ZNQCLcB/s1600/dDFownload.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"188\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-oiWocZdKyJk/WO9-WmhjkHI/AAAAAAABSds/Q3ENFjw7iAwccwCDl1K0Ntp9--qIJ-ZNQCLcB/s400/dDFownload.jpg\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<iframe allowfullscreen=\"\" class=\"YOUTUBE-iframe-video\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/s0Y5JJmsVfs/0.jpg\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/s0Y5JJmsVfs?feature=player_embedded\" width=\"320\"></iframe></div>\n<b><span style=\"color: red;\"><br /></span></b>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Migrating motor\ncomplexes (or migrating myoelectric complex or migratory motor complex or\nmigratory myoelectric complex or MMC) are waves of electrical activity that\nsweep through the intestines in a regular cycle during fasting.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">These motor complexes trigger peristaltic\nwaves, which facilitate transportation of indigestible substances such as bone,\nfiber, and foreign bodies from the stomach, through the SMALL intestine, past\nthe ileocecal sphincter non-return valve , and into the LARGE intestine<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The MMC occurs every\n90\u2013120 minutes during the interdigestive phase (i.e., between meals) and is\nresponsible for the rumbling experienced when hungry.&nbsp;&nbsp; It also serves to transport bacteria from\nthe small intestine to the large intestine and to inhibit the migration of\ncolonic bacteria into the terminal ileum.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The MMC is &nbsp;partially regulated by motilin, which is\ninitiated in the stomach as a response to vagal stimulation, and does not\ndirectly depend on extrinsic nerves.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The result of poor MMC\nfunction is constipation and/or SIBO, or small intestinal bacteria overgrowth. &nbsp;This can cause lots of digestion problems (bloating, gas, constipation,\ndiarrhea, food allergies).<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Part of what stimulates\nthe MMC is fasting, so take breaks between meals\u2014don\u2019t keep eating like a CUNT<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A hormone produced by\nthe stomach called motilin&nbsp; helps\nregulate the MMC. &nbsp;Motilin release is\nregulated by the vagus nerve, that comes from the brain and goes to all of the\norgans of the chest and abdomen.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Pranayama&nbsp; and surya namaskar stimulates the vagus\nnerve.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A high cholesterol diet\ninhibits the MMC, so keep your cholesterol intake low to moderate.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">SSRImedications also inhibit movement in the gut.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The migrating motor\ncomplex cleans up your small intestine when you\u2019re done eating by sweeping\nundigested food particles and bacteria from the stomach and small intestine in\nto the large intestine<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The basics of turning\non the migrating motor complex are pretty simple.&nbsp; Approximately 3 hours after your last meal,\nit begins.&nbsp; Your stomach begins moving\nand you get a nice squirt of stomach acid.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This mixes with bacteria left over in the stomach as well as\nincompletely digested food particles.&nbsp;\nThe acid helps kill any bacteria that may still be alive and the\ncontractions help mobilize bacteria and the food particles for removal.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Next, the pylorus opens\nand the contents of the stomach move in to the duodenum.&nbsp; The pancreas and gallbladder squirt in some\npancreatic enzymes, bicarbonate, and bile ( PITTA ) &nbsp;for good measure to neutralize the acid.&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;During this first phase, the pylorus stays\nopen, making this an opportune time for trapped gas ( VATA ) to get burped out.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Your small intestine\npropels the digestive enzymes and loose bacteria gradually toward the\nLARGE&nbsp; intestine.&nbsp; All along the way, the antimicrobial effects\nof bile kill bacteria and keep it from slipping across the gut wall into the\nblood.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Once bile ( PITTA )\nmakes it to the ileum, bile acids get reabsorbed, sent to the liver, and\nre-stored in the gall bladder.&nbsp; The\nprocess of bile absorption also brings another welcomed effect: the release of\nantimicrobial peptides to kill most of the live bacteria remaining.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The bacteria get pushed in to the LARGE\nintestine&nbsp; and you\u2019re ready for the next\nround of the migrating motor complex, or your next meal.&nbsp; This entire process takes approximately 90\nminutes. This mucus (KAPHA ) layer plays a big role in keeping your gut\nhealthy.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The mucus layer prevents a large immune reaction every time you eat.&nbsp; By keeping bacteria away and requiring them\nto travel to enterocytes, your mucus layer gives your immune system time to\ntake out bacteria before they can become a problem.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Along with the\nintegrity of the mucus layer, constant motion in the direction of the colon\nprevents the mucus layer from accumulating too much bacteria just like water\nfrom a moving creek has less bacteria than a standing pond.&nbsp; Motion is good, stagnation is bad.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Fasting is very good\nfor reducing levels of inflammation throughout the body. The white man always\nwondered by the Indian fasted. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">CHUTNEY MARYs CRY WITH\nONE FINGER UP THEIR ASSHOLES \u2014WE WILL NEVER FAST .. WE ARE BRAVE HEARTS \u2026 &nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<b><span style=\"color: red;\"><br /></span></b>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Contractions in the\nsmall intestine serve three general functions: mixing of the ingesta with\ndigestive enzymes and other secretions; circulation of the intestinal contents\nto facilitate contact with the intestinal mucosa; and net caudal propulsion of\nthe intestinal contents. Intestinal contractions are governed by four motility\npatterns: segmentation, peristalsis, intestinointestinal inhibition, and the\nMMC<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The LARGE intestine (\nCOLON ) serves two important functions: (a) extraction of water and\nelectrolytes from the luminal contents in the ascending and transverse colon\nand (b) storage of feces and control of defecation in the descending colon.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This specialization of function has been\nattributed to regional differences in colonic motility patterns. Electrical\nslow-wave frequency and rhythmic phasic contractions are slower in the proximal\ncolon (cecum and ascending colon), thus facilitating extraction of water from\nthe fecal mass by diffusion and active transport.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Retrograde giant contractions\nand anti-peristalsis further facilitate mixing of contents in the proximal\ncolon. In contrast, motility of the distal colon (transverse and descending\ncolon) is characterized primarily by migrating spike bursts and powerful giant\nmigrating contractions that propagate the fecal mass toward the rectum<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">During fasting, the\ngallbladder is relaxed and stores bile ( PITTA ) . When feeding resumes,\nhormonal (cholecystokinin) and neural (acetylcholine) mechanisms stimulate\nsimultaneous gallbladder contraction and sphincter of Oddi relaxation, thereby\nfacilitating emptying of bile into the small intestine.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-LLy9bHAl-b0/WO-JKPxSV-I/AAAAAAABSd8/3MEuYtakOQAM_RuBNARAON2wu0Es3xjPwCLcB/s1600/downlojjd.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"237\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-LLy9bHAl-b0/WO-JKPxSV-I/AAAAAAABSd8/3MEuYtakOQAM_RuBNARAON2wu0Es3xjPwCLcB/s400/downlojjd.png\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<b><span style=\"color: red;\"><br /></span></b>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Diarrhea may be an\nunder-appreciated symptom of bile acid malabsorption. Bile acid is produced by\nthe liver to help absorb lipids in the small intestine. Diarrhea can,\ntherefore, be a signal from your body that a greater problem exists.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Disorders may include\nCrohn\u2019s disease, Celiac disease (gluten intolerance), liver cancer or\npancreatitis<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Magnesium can stimulate\nthe movement of stool through the bowels by serving as a muscle relaxant .\nMagnesium is easily depleted under chronic stress but can be replenished in our\nfood supply.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Excellent food sources of\nmagnesium include green leafy vegetables, nuts, seeds and some fruits such a\nbananas and apples.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Recurrent use of\nantibiotics causes a disruption in normal bacterial balance and has been\nimplicated as a cause of dysbiosis.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Antibiotics do not kill\nVIRUSES<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">As the bacteria over\ngrow they damage the lining of the SMALL intestinal tract.&nbsp; Bacteria produce and enzyme called\nglycosidase that destroy brush border enzymes in our intestinal lining.&nbsp; This reduction in our digestive enzymes\nreduces our ability to digest and absorb our food, providing more food for the\nbacteria allowing them to become even more overgrown.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A vicious cycle.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">As the bacteria continue to\ndamage the intestinal lining, intestinal hyperpermeability (leaky guy)\ndevelops. Leaky gut has been associated with food allergies and/or intolerance,\nautoimmune conditions and fibromyalgia<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<b><span style=\"color: red;\"><br /></span></b>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The gallbladder is a\nsmall, pear-shaped sac located below the liver (on the right side of the\nabdomen) which contains approximately a half cup of yellowish-greenish fluid\ncalled gallbladder bile.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The bile originates in the liver before moving into\nthe gallbladder, where the bile becomes 10 times more concentrated. The\nhealthy, functioning gallbladder then acts as a storage reservoir for\nconcentrated bile before it moves into the duodenum (small intestine).<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The main function of\nbile is to assist the body in digesting fats by dividing the fats into thin\ndroplets. It helps pancreatic enzymes split the fats into small particles that\ncan pass through the walls of the intestines. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When the semi-digested\nfood exits the stomach and moves into the small intestine the gallbladder\ncontracts causing the concentrated bile to move through the bile ducts into the\nsmall intestine. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"background-color: white;\">WESTERN DOCTORS WHO DO\nNOT UNDERSTAND SIBO ARE QUICK TO ORDER SURGICAL REMOVAL OF THE GALL BLADDER </span><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Once the gallbladder is\nremoved liquid liver bile flows out constantly from the common bile duct\nstraight into the small intestine instead of being stored in the gallbladder.\nThis low quality liquid liver bile that constantly flows into the duodenum\ncannot properly digest the fats, causing fat intolerance and diarrhea in some\npeople.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Bile is instrumental in\nremoving dangerous toxins such as bile pigments, bile acids, cholesterol and\nheavy metals. The antimicrobial property of concentrated gallbladder bile\nassists in keeping the small intestine from dangerous invaders such as bad\nbacteria, parasites, and yeasts.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Consequently, absence of the gallbladder leads\nto Candida-yeast and Small Intestine Bacterial Overgrowth (SIBO) which can\ncreate gas and indigestion.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<b><span style=\"color: red;\"><br /></span></b>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Healthy alkaline bile\nneutralizes the semi-digested acidic food from the stomach therefore creating\nthe proper alkaline milieu in the small intestine for pancreatic enzymes to\nwork.&nbsp; Pancreatic enzymes require an\nalkaline condition in the small intestine digest consumed food.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When the\ngallbladder bile is not alkaline, indigested foods in the small intestine are\nfermented causing gas, bloating, abdominal cramps, and HAJAAAR &nbsp;visits to the bathroom.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When there is no\ngallbladder, the increasing pressure inside the pancreatic duct can cause\nactivation of the pancreatic enzymes inside the pancreas and as a consequence,\ninflammation of the pancreas can develop.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The liver, gallbladder,\npancreas, duodenum, bile ducts, and muscles valves work together due to the\nperfect regulation of the body. &nbsp;Cutting\nthe nerve branches surrounding the gallbladder can disrupt the proper work of\nthe Sphincter of Oddi - the valve between the bile and pancreatic ducts and the\nSMALL intestine<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Almost 20% of patients\nafter gallbladder surgery suffer from Sphincter of Oddi Dysfunction. Spasm of\nthis strategic valve leads to backup of the bile and pancreatic juices with\nresultant pain, nausea, and possible development of pancreatitis.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Concentrated\ngallbladder bile is necessary for intestinal motility, digestion and the\nabsorption of fat-soluble vitamins such as A, D, E, and K. The lack of\ngallbladder bile creates less peristaltic movement which makes people prone to\nconstipation.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The main reasons for\ngallbladder surgery are inflammation and/or gallbladder stones. Removal of the\ngallbladder does not stop the production of stones and inflammation of the bile\nducts. Therefore, inflammation and collection of the stones, both in the liver\nand in the bile ducts, can be often observed in people without a gallbladder.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2015/06/kidney-and-gallbladder-stones-capt-ajit.html\" style=\"background-color: lime;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2015/06/kidney-and-gallbladder-stones-capt-ajit.html</a><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Although loss of these\nfunctions of the gallbladder is not life threatening, removal of the\ngallbladder can cause many unpleasant symptoms. For some people life after gallbladder\nremoval is a miserable existence. This condition is called post-cholecystectomy\nsyndrome.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The term post-cholecystectomy syndrome (PCS) describes the presence\nof symptoms after cholecystectomy (gallbladder removal surgery).<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In a healthy,\nfunctioning body the gallbladder, pancreas, bile and pancreatic juices are\nnaturally alkaline. Whole body acidity is one of the main causes of liver,\ngallbladder and pancreas malfunction.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Acidity causes biochemical changes in the\nbile that makes it corrosively irritating to the bile ducts, sphincter of Oddi\nand the small intestine.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Aggressive acidic liver bile irritates surrounding\ntissues, causes jerky contractions and refluxes. This aggressive mix of the\nacidic bile and pancreatic juices regurgitates into the stomach and esophagus\nand/or causes spasms of the sphincter of Oddi.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This can be the cause of the\nheartburn, nausea and upper abdominal pain often experienced after gallbladder\nsurgery.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">An alkaline diet\ninvolves eating mostly alkaline-based foods and avoiding acid-forming foods\nsuch as sugars, red meat, sodas, dairy products, white flour, white rice,\nalcohol, etc. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Typically, people\nwithout a gallbladder have two problems: one is Candida-yeast overgrowth,\nanother is food sensitivity. An elimination diet and anti-Candida diet can be\nvery beneficial for these conditions.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Cellular\nmagnesium-potassium, another alkalizing agent, also can decrease acidity in the\nbody. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">To know more about\nMagnesium and Potassium read the post below\u2014read all 4 parts<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: lime; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2016/09/marathon-running-secrets-of.html\" style=\"background-color: lime;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2016/09/marathon-running-secrets-of.html</a><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<b><span style=\"background-color: white; color: red; font-size: large;\"><br /></span></b></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<b><span style=\"background-color: white; color: red; font-size: large;\">WE HAVE CUNTS RUNNING SPORTS IN INDIA</span></b></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">How can we know if our\nbody is acidic or alkaline? Checking saliva and urine pH by litmus paper is the\neasy and inexpensive way to verify body acidity. If saliva and urine pH are\nfrequently less than 6.6 it can be a warning sign of total body acidity.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<b><span style=\"color: red;\"><br /></span></b>\n<br />\n<div class=\"avatar-image-container\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; float: left; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 16px; margin: 0.2em 0px 0px; max-height: 36px; overflow: hidden; width: 36px;\">\n<img src=\"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/zFdxGE77vvD2w5xHy6jkVuElKv-U9_9qLkRYK8OnbDeJPtjSZ82UPq5w6hJ-SA=s35\" style=\"border: 1px solid rgb(238, 238, 238); max-width: 36px;\" /></div>\n<div class=\"comment-block\" id=\"c5780050030093973607\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 16px; margin-left: 48px; position: relative;\">\n<div class=\"comment-header\" id=\"bc_0_178M\" kind=\"m\" style=\"margin: 0px 0px 8px;\">\n<cite class=\"user\" style=\"font-style: normal; font-weight: bold;\"><a href=\"https://www.blogger.com/profile/08365590956295754270\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration-line: none;\">Razor Skidrow</a></cite><span class=\"icon user\" style=\"font-weight: bold;\"></span><span class=\"datetime secondary-text\" style=\"margin-left: 6px;\"><a href=\"https://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2017/07/gayatri-mantra-savitr-savitur-saraswati.html?showComment=1499824174451#c5780050030093973607\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration-line: none;\">July 12, 2017 at 7:19 AM</a></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-content\" id=\"bc_0_178MC\" style=\"margin-bottom: 8px; text-align: justify;\">\nAjit, my brother has been diagnosed with ulcerative colitis. He vomited very recently, and now has a little bit of heart ache. These Western doctors cannot be trusted, plus he also takes depression pills.<br /><br />What do you think can be done to reduce these side effects? This condition is irreversible I know but still.</div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"comment-replies\" id=\"bc_0_178BR\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 16px; margin-left: 36px; margin-top: 1em;\">\n<span id=\"bc_0_178b+seedxwkD\" kind=\"d\"><div class=\"comment-thread inline-thread\" id=\"bc_0_177T\" kind=\"t\" style=\"background-color: #eeeeee; margin: 8px 0px; padding: 0.5em 1em;\" t=\"0\" u=\"0\">\n<span class=\"thread-toggle thread-expanded\" id=\"bc_0_177TT\" kind=\"g\" style=\"cursor: pointer; display: inline-block;\"><span class=\"thread-count\" id=\"bc_0_177TN\"><div class=\"thread-dropContainer thread-expanded\" id=\"bc_0_177TD\">\n<span class=\"thread-drop\"></span></div>\n</span></span><ol class=\"thread-chrome thread-expanded\" id=\"bc_0_177TC\" style=\"list-style-type: none; padding: 0px;\">\n<li class=\"comment\" id=\"bc_0_177B\" kind=\"b\" style=\"margin: 0px 0px 16px; padding: 16px 0px 8px;\"><div class=\"avatar-image-container\" style=\"float: left; margin: 0.2em 0px 0px; max-height: 36px; overflow: hidden; width: 36px;\">\n<img src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-57G2xiZ-5tM/WJwrrVpmOmI/AAAAAAABQqo/-9wsspdm4RAiWSVRYXpBpkgoVBQdEyLRQCK4B/s35/*\" style=\"border: 1px solid rgb(238, 238, 238); max-width: 36px;\" /></div>\n<div class=\"comment-block\" id=\"c4780092400576225158\" style=\"margin-left: 48px; position: relative;\">\n<div class=\"comment-header\" id=\"bc_0_177M\" kind=\"m\" style=\"margin: 0px 0px 8px;\">\n<cite class=\"user blog-author\" style=\"font-style: normal; font-weight: bold;\"><a href=\"https://www.blogger.com/profile/14410812789424637654\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration-line: none;\">Capt. Ajit Vadakayil</a></cite><span class=\"icon user blog-author\" style=\"background-image: url(&quot;data:image/png; background-repeat: no-repeat; display: inline-block; font-weight: bold; height: 18px; margin: 0px 0px -4px 6px; width: 18px;\"></span><span class=\"datetime secondary-text\" style=\"margin-left: 6px;\"><a href=\"https://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2017/07/gayatri-mantra-savitr-savitur-saraswati.html?showComment=1499856592802#c4780092400576225158\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration-line: none;\">July 12, 2017 at 4:19 PM</a></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-content\" id=\"bc_0_177MC\" style=\"margin-bottom: 8px; text-align: justify;\">\n<br />In Kerala we never had Ulcerative Colitis as we cooked in Virgin coconut oil and had our curries infused with fresh turmeric.<br /><br />Excessive consumtion of humpless cow beef causes UC<br /><br />Ulcerative Colitis is a condition that causes inflammation and ulceration of the inner lining of the rectum and colon (the large bowel). In UC, tiny ulcers develop on the surface of the lining and these may bleed and produce pus.<br /><br />The inflammation usually begins in the rectum and lower colon, but it may affect the entire colon. If UC only affects the rectum, it is called proctitis, while if it affects the whole colon it may be called total colitis or pancolitis.<br /><br />It\u2019s one of the two main forms of Inflammatory Bowel Disease (IBD). The other is Crohn\u2019s Disease which is monopolized by Ashkenazi Jews<br /><br />HOMOSEXUAL MALES WHO ENGAGE IN ANAL SEX ARE MORE PRONE TO UC<br /><br />Ulcerative Colitis is a chronic condition. This means that it is ongoing and life-long, although you may have periods of good health (remission), as well as times when symptoms are more active (relapses or flare-ups).<br /><br />The most common symptoms are:----<br />\u2022 Diarrhoea<br />\u2022 Cramping pains in the abdomen<br />\u2022 Tiredness and fatigue<br />\u2022 Feeling generally unwell or feverish<br />\u2022 Loss of appetite and weight loss<br />\u2022 Anaemia (a reduced level of red blood cells).<br /><br />One in 200 people in the west have UC because of consumption of A1 milk, processed foods and GM foods.<br /><br />It can start at any age, though it often appears for the first time between the ages of 15 and 25. It affects men and women equally.<br /><br />More than a third of people with UC develop other conditions outside of the digestive system, mainly affecting the joints, eyes and skin.<br /><br />Inflammation of the joints (arthritis) affects about one out of 10 people with UC. Some people with UC also develop ankylosing spondylitis, a condition in which the joints in the spine and pelvis become inflamed and stiff.<br /><br />A variety of other health conditions can be associated with UC, including:----<br />skin problems, such as mouth ulcers, blisters and ulcers on the skin, and painful red swellings, usually on the legs<br />inflammation of the eyes<br />thinner and weaker bones<br />liver inflammation<br />blood clots (including deep vein thrombosis)<br />anaemia.<br /><br />Flare-ups can be disruptive to relationships and work \u2013 sometimes you may need to cancel engagements and take time off when you are feeling unwell.<br /><br />Around a quarter of people are children or adolescents when they are diagnosed with IBD, and symptoms in young people often appear around the age of 12. Ulcerative Colitis in children tends to be more extensive in children than adults, and consequently more severe .<br /><br />Ulcerative colitis affects only the colon and rectum. Crohn's can affect any part of the digestive tract.<br /><br />In severe cases, people may have diarrhea 10 to 20 times a day.<br /><br />The disease can also cause other problems, such as joint pain, eye problems, or liver disease.<br /><br />Tests that may be done include:----<br /><br />A colonoscopy. In this test, a doctor uses a thin, lighted tool to look at the inside of your entire colon. At the same time, the doctor may take a sample (biopsy) of the lining of the colon.<br />Blood tests, which look for infection or inflammation.<br />Stool sample testing to look for blood, infection, and white blood cells.<br />Crohn\u2019s disease can affect any part of the gastrointestinal (GI) tract, but ulcerative colitis affects only the colon. Additionally, while Crohn\u2019s disease can affect all layers of the bowel wall, ulcerative colitis only affects the lining of the colon.<br />While both ulcerative colitis and Crohn\u2019s disease are types of inflammatory bowel diseases (IBD), they should not be confused with irritable bowel Syndrome (IBS), a disorder that affects the muscle contractions of the colon. IBS is not characterized by intestinal inflammation..<br /><br />continued to 2---</div>\n<span class=\"comment-actions secondary-text\" id=\"bc_0_177MN\" kind=\"m\"><span class=\"item-control blog-admin pid-1783552029\" style=\"display: inline;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-replies\" id=\"bc_0_177BR\" style=\"margin-left: 36px; margin-top: 1em;\">\n</div>\n<div class=\"comment-replybox-single\" id=\"bc_0_177B_box\" style=\"margin-left: 48px; margin-top: 5px;\">\n</div>\n</li>\n<li class=\"comment\" id=\"bc_0_202B\" kind=\"b\" style=\"margin: 0px 0px 16px; padding: 0.25em 0px 8px;\"><div class=\"avatar-image-container\" style=\"float: left; margin: 0.2em 0px 0px; max-height: 36px; overflow: hidden; width: 36px;\">\n<img src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-DUOJiRC5obw/UwiDtflONuI/AAAAAAAAppU/hpxnNJK2CIw/s113/*\" style=\"border: 1px solid rgb(238, 238, 238); max-width: 36px;\" /></div>\n<div class=\"comment-block\" id=\"c900289221694158819\" style=\"margin-left: 48px; position: relative;\">\n<div class=\"comment-header\" id=\"bc_0_202M\" kind=\"m\" style=\"margin: 0px 0px 8px;\">\n<cite class=\"user\" style=\"font-style: normal; font-weight: bold;\"><a href=\"http://www.blogger.com/profile/14410812789424637654\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration-line: none;\">Capt. Ajit Vadakayil</a></cite><span class=\"icon user\" style=\"font-weight: bold;\"></span><span class=\"datetime secondary-text\" style=\"margin-left: 6px;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2017/07/gayatri-mantra-savitr-savitur-saraswati.html?showComment=1499856668741#c900289221694158819\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration-line: none;\">July 12, 2017 at 4:21 PM</a></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-content\" id=\"bc_0_202MC\" style=\"margin-bottom: 8px; text-align: justify;\">\nCONTINUED FROM 1 --<br /><br />Ulcerative colitis-----<br />Limited to the large intestine (colon and rectum)<br />Occurs in the rectum and colon, involving a part or the entire colon<br />Appears in a continuous pattern<br />Inflammation occurs in innermost lining of the intestine<br />About 30% of people in remission will experience a relapse in the next year<br /><br />Ulcerative colitis is 3 times more common than Crohn disease.<br /><br />HOWEVER --CHRONS DIFFERENCE--<br /><br />Inflammation may develop anywhere in the GI tract from the mouth to the anus<br />Most commonly occurs at the end of the small intestine<br />May appear in patches<br />May extend through entire thickness of bowel wall<br />About 72 % of people in remission will have at least 1 relapse over the next 4 years<br /><br />The UC inflammation causes your bowel to move its contents rapidly and empty frequently. As cells on the surface of the lining of your bowel die, ulcers form. The ulcers cause bleeding and discharge of mucus and pus.<br /><br />Ulcerative colitis may cause additional conditions such as:--<br /><br />joint pain<br />joint swelling<br />nausea and decreased appetite<br />skin problems<br />mouth sores<br />eye inflammation<br />Ulcerative colitis increases your risk of colon cancer. The longer you have the disease, the higher your risk of this cancer.<br /><br />Other complications of ulcerative colitis include:--<br /><br />thickening of the intestinal wall<br />sepsis, or blood infection<br />severe dehydration<br />toxic megacolon, or a rapidly swelling colon<br />liver disease (rare)<br />intestinal bleeding<br />kidney stones<br />inflammation of your skin, joints, and eyes<br />rupture of your colon<br />ankylosing spondylitis, which involves inflammation of joints between your spinal bones<br /><br />Tests to diagnose ulcerative colitis often include:<br /><br />Stool test: A doctor examines your stool for blood, bacteria, and parasites.<br />Endoscopy: A doctor uses a flexible tube to examine your stomach, esophagus, and small intestine.<br />Colonoscopy: This diagnostic test involves insertion of a long, flexible tube into your rectum to examine the inside of your colon.<br />Biopsy: A surgeon removes a tissue sample from your colon for analysis.<br />CT scan: This is a specialized X-ray of your abdomen and pelvis.<br />Blood tests are often useful in the diagnosis of ulcerative colitis. A complete blood count looks for signs of anemia (low blood count). Other tests indicate inflammation such as a high level of C-reactive protein and a high sedimentation rate. Your doctor may also order specialized antibody tests.<br /><br /><br />If your symptoms are severe, you\u2019ll need to be hospitalized to correct the effects of dehydration and loss of electrolytes that diarrhea causes and to treat any complications<br /><br />The severity of UC can be graded as follows:---<br />Mild: Bleeding per rectum, fewer than 4 bowel motions per day<br />Moderate: Bleeding per rectum, more than 4 bowel motions per day<br />Severe: Bleeding per rectum, more than 4 bowel motions per day, and a systemic illness with hypoalbuminemia (<30 br=\"\" g=\"\">The diagnosis of ulcerative colitis is best made with endoscopy and mucosal biopsy for histopathology.<br />Rectal involvement occurs even when the rest of the colon is spared.<br /><br />Fecal studies have shown that the composition of gut bacteria in those with ulcerative colitis is very different to that in healthy people, so probiotics may be helpful for correcting the imbalance.<br /><br />Your body absorbs nitrates from food that you eat and these turn into nitrites in the body. Usually, healthy urine shouldn\u2019t contain nitrites. However, if you have any kind of bacterial infection in your urinary tract, nitrites will show up in your urine.<br /><br />Nitrites in your urine could also mean that you have an inflammatory bowel disease (IBD). Inflammation in part or all of your digestive tract is called an inflammatory bowel disease. This usually includes ulcerative colitis and Crohn\u2019s disease.<br /><br />CONTINUED TO 3-</30></div>\n<span class=\"comment-actions secondary-text\" id=\"bc_0_202MN\" kind=\"m\"><span class=\"item-control blog-admin pid-1783552029\" style=\"display: inline;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-replies\" id=\"bc_0_202BR\" style=\"margin-left: 36px; margin-top: 1em;\">\n</div>\n<div class=\"comment-replybox-single\" id=\"bc_0_202B_box\" style=\"margin-left: 48px; margin-top: 5px;\">\n</div>\n</li>\n<li class=\"comment\" id=\"bc_0_203B\" kind=\"b\" style=\"margin: 0px 0px 16px; padding: 0.25em 0px 8px;\"><div class=\"avatar-image-container\" style=\"float: left; margin: 0.2em 0px 0px; max-height: 36px; overflow: hidden; width: 36px;\">\n<img src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-DUOJiRC5obw/UwiDtflONuI/AAAAAAAAppU/hpxnNJK2CIw/s113/*\" style=\"border: 1px solid rgb(238, 238, 238); max-width: 36px;\" /></div>\n<div class=\"comment-block\" id=\"c599600132629490875\" style=\"margin-left: 48px; position: relative;\">\n<div class=\"comment-header\" id=\"bc_0_203M\" kind=\"m\" style=\"margin: 0px 0px 8px;\">\n<cite class=\"user\" style=\"font-style: normal; font-weight: bold;\"><a href=\"http://www.blogger.com/profile/14410812789424637654\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration-line: none;\">Capt. Ajit Vadakayil</a></cite><span class=\"icon user\" style=\"font-weight: bold;\"></span><span class=\"datetime secondary-text\" style=\"margin-left: 6px;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2017/07/gayatri-mantra-savitr-savitur-saraswati.html?showComment=1499856735008#c599600132629490875\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration-line: none;\">July 12, 2017 at 4:22 PM</a></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-content\" id=\"bc_0_203MC\" style=\"margin-bottom: 8px; text-align: justify;\">\nCONTINUED FROM 2-<br /><br />Ulcerative colitis occasionally involves the terminal ileum, as a result of an incompetent ileocecal valve. In these cases, which may constitute as many as 10% of patients, the reflux of noxious inflammatory mediators from the colon results in superficial mucosal inflammation of the terminal ileum, called backwash ileitis. Up to about 30 cm of the terminal ileum may be affected.<br /><br />A variety of immunologic changes have been documented in ulcerative colitis. Subsets of T cells accumulate in the lamina propria of the diseased colonic segment. In patients with ulcerative colitis, these T cells are cytotoxic to the colonic epithelium. This change is accompanied by an increase in the population of B cells and plasma cells, with increased production of immunoglobulin G (IgG) and immunoglobulin E (IgE).<br /><br />The ulcerated areas are soon covered by granulation tissue. Excessive fibrosis is not a feature of the disease. The undermining of mucosa and an excess of granulation tissue lead to the formation of polypoidal mucosal excrescences, which are known as inflammatory polyps or pseudopolyps.<br />.<br />Ulcerative colitis is the result of an abnormal response by your body's immune system. Normally, the cells and proteins that make up the immune system protect you from infection. In people with IBD, however, the immune system mistakes food, bacteria, and other materials in the intestine for foreign or invading substances. When this happens, the body sends white blood cells into the lining of the intestines, where they produce chronic inflammation and ulcerations.<br />Foreign substances (antigens) in the environment may be the direct cause of the inflammation, or they may stimulate the body's defenses to produce an inflammation that continues without control.<br /><br /><br />http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2017/05/nitrate-water-pollution-chemical.html<br />http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2010/12/ayurvedic-massage-and-quantum-medicine.html<br />http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2013/07/nutritious-a1-milk-of-vedic-cows-with.html<br />http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2013/08/probiotics-prebiotics-friendly-gut.html<br />http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2013/08/probiotics-prebiotics-friendly-gut.html<br />http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2017/03/ibs-irritable-bowel-syndrome-vagus_14.html<br />http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2017/04/small-intestinal-bacterial-overgrowth.html<br /><br />85% of IBD patients are low in vitamin D<br /><br />DO SURYANAMASKAR<br /><br />HAVE NATUROLAX BEFORE SLEEPING<br /><br />Psyllium husk are both known to increase butyrate production. Butyrate helps to repair the intestinal wall and reduce inflammation<br /><br />Surgery is necessary when there is massive bleeding, chronic and debilitating symptoms, perforation of your colon, or a severe blockage. A CT scan or colonoscopy can detect these serious problems.<br /><br />Surgery involves removing your entire colon with the creation of a new pathway for waste. This pathway can be out through a small opening in your abdominal wall or redirected back through the end of your rectum.<br /><br />To redirect waste through your abdominal wall, your surgeon will make a small opening in your abdominal wall. The tip of your lower small intestine, or the ileum, is then brought to the skin\u2019s surface. Waste will drain through the opening into a bag. You will find that Jews have this contraption maximum on this planet by percentage<br /><br />If waste is able to be redirected through your rectum, your surgeon removes the diseased part of your colon and rectum, but retains the outer muscles of your rectum. The surgeon then attaches your small intestine to the rectum to form a small pouch. After this surgery, you\u2019re able to pass stool through your rectum. Bowel movements will be more frequent and watery than normal.<br /><br />CONTINUED TO 4-</div>\n<span class=\"comment-actions secondary-text\" id=\"bc_0_203MN\" kind=\"m\"><span class=\"item-control blog-admin pid-1783552029\" style=\"display: inline;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-replies\" id=\"bc_0_203BR\" style=\"margin-left: 36px; margin-top: 1em;\">\n</div>\n<div class=\"comment-replybox-single\" id=\"bc_0_203B_box\" style=\"margin-left: 48px; margin-top: 5px;\">\n</div>\n</li>\n<li class=\"comment\" id=\"bc_0_204B\" kind=\"b\" style=\"border-bottom: 0px; margin: 0px 0px 16px; padding: 0.25em 0px 0px;\"><div class=\"avatar-image-container\" style=\"float: left; margin: 0.2em 0px 0px; max-height: 36px; overflow: hidden; width: 36px;\">\n<img src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-DUOJiRC5obw/UwiDtflONuI/AAAAAAAAppU/hpxnNJK2CIw/s113/*\" style=\"border: 1px solid rgb(238, 238, 238); max-width: 36px;\" /></div>\n<div class=\"comment-block\" id=\"c6501120340593266000\" style=\"margin-left: 48px; position: relative;\">\n<div class=\"comment-header\" id=\"bc_0_204M\" kind=\"m\" style=\"margin: 0px 0px 8px;\">\n<cite class=\"user\" style=\"font-style: normal; font-weight: bold;\"><a href=\"http://www.blogger.com/profile/14410812789424637654\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration-line: none;\">Capt. Ajit Vadakayil</a></cite><span class=\"icon user\" style=\"font-weight: bold;\"></span><span class=\"datetime secondary-text\" style=\"margin-left: 6px;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2017/07/gayatri-mantra-savitr-savitur-saraswati.html?showComment=1499856803357#c6501120340593266000\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration-line: none;\">July 12, 2017 at 4:23 PM</a></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-content\" id=\"bc_0_204MC\" style=\"margin-bottom: 8px; text-align: justify;\">\nCONTINUED FROM 3-<br /><br />Practices that may help include:----<br /><br />drinking small amounts of water throughout the day<br />eating smaller meals throughout the day<br />limiting your intake of high-fiber foods<br />avoiding fatty foods<br />avoiding artificial sweeteners<br /><br />Ulcerative colitis can be hard to live with. During a flare-up, it may seem like you are always running to the bathroom. White people who use rough toilet paper literally have no skin on their assholes. They wear red underwear<br /><br />Capt ajit vadakayil<br />..</div>\n</div>\n</li>\n</ol>\n</div>\n</span></div>\n<b><span style=\"color: red;\"><br /><br /></span></b><b><span style=\"background-color: white; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Understanding how your brain works and how\nmemories are created is<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">important because this understanding\nincreases your choice of behaviour.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">A&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt;\">lot of the memories, emotions, and resulting\nbehaviours are unconscious and</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">you\u2019re held in a trap, powerless to help\nyourself until you can understand<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">how your memories were created and you can\nchoose which memories affect<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">your present.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Memories are normally created when\ninformation from the RAS Reticular Activating System&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt;\">&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt;\">is\nsent to the part of the brain called the amygdala, where the data are given an\nemotional</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">weighting before being passed on to the\nhippocampus. The hippocampus<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">evaluates the data against those held in\nlong-term memory and presents<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">them to the cortex for analysis and re-filing\nback into long-term memory.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">YOGA DEALT WITH THE <b style=\"background-color: white;\">AMYGDALA</b><o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><b style=\"background-color: white;\"><br /></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<iframe allowfullscreen=\"\" class=\"YOUTUBE-iframe-video\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/YB9rs4tEAaE/0.jpg\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/YB9rs4tEAaE?feature=player_embedded\" width=\"320\"></iframe></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot;
